Title: Eric Northman
Content: Eric Northman es un personaje ficticio en "The Southern Vampire Mysteries", una serie de trece libros escritos por la autora más vendida del "New York Times" Charlaine Harris. Es un vampiro, un poco más de mil años, y se presenta por primera vez en la primera novela, "Dead hasta Dark" y aparece en todas las novelas posteriores. Dado que la serie de libros se cuenta desde la perspectiva en primera persona de Sookie Stackhouse, lo que los lectores perciben de su personaje está influenciado por lo que Sookie comprende. La serie de televisión de HBO "True Blood" se basa en esta serie de libros y el personaje de Eric Northman se retrata de manera algo diferente. Una lista de personajes de "True Blood" tiene una descripción detallada del personaje de Eric del programa de televisión.

Document ID: 2
Title: Emily Stackhouse
Content: Sometime in the mid 1840s, the botanist Charles Alexander Johns saw Stackhouse's watercolours and asked her to provide illustrations for a series of popular natural history books that he was publishing through the Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge. The first two were "Forest Trees of Britain" (1847) and "A Week at the Lizard" (1848, focusing on the Lizard peninsula in Cornwall); in both, some of the illustrations were engravings based on watercolours by Stackhouse, uncredited, but signed 'E.S.' This was followed by Johns's best-known book, "Flowers of the Field", published in two volumes in 1851 with over 200 uncredited illustrations by Stackhouse. Referred to as "the bible of the amateur botanist," its success was such that it went into more than 50 editions and was still in print a century after it first came out. In addition, after Johns and Stackhouse were dead, the SPCK continued to use Stackhouse's images in other books; it is estimated that they had been printed in at least 15 and as many as 30 different books by the end of the 19th century.

Title: History of Bangladesh
Content: The decision to effect the Partition of Bengal was announced in July 1905 by the Viceroy of India, Lord Curzon. The partition took place on 16 October 1905 and separated the largely Muslim eastern areas from the largely Hindu western areas. The former province of Bengal was divided into two new provinces "Bengal" (comprising western Bengal as well as the province of Bihar and Orissa) and Eastern Bengal and Assam with Dacca as the capital of the latter. Partition was promoted for administrative reasons: Bengal was geographically as large as France and had a significantly larger population. Curzon stated the eastern region was neglected and under-governed. By splitting the province, an improved administration could be established in the east, where subsequently, the population would benefit from new schools and employment opportunities. The Hindus of West Bengal who dominated Bengal's business and rural life complained that the division would make them a minority in a province that would incorporate the province of Bihar and Orissa. Indians were outraged at what they recognised as a "divide and rule" policy.
---

The orientation of the new building is reverse what the old one was. The new churches "front" sits in the footprint of the old churches "rear". In 2012, it was revealed that the parish of Notre Dame de Lourdes would be merging with the parish of Immaculate Conception in Fall River. This occurred in June 2012 and they will be using Notre Dame as their church, taking on the name St. Bernadette.

claim: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child”
question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.

Title: Banco de esperma
Content: Cuando los bancos de esperma pueden operar, a menudo se controlan por la legislación local que está destinada principalmente a proteger al niño no nacido, pero que también puede proporcionar un compromiso entre las opiniones contradictorias que rodean su operación. Un ejemplo particular de esto es el control que a menudo se coloca en el número de niños que un solo donante puede padre y que puede ser diseñado para proteger contra la consanguinidad. Sin embargo, dicha legislación generalmente no puede evitar que un banco de esperma proporcione esperma donante fuera de la jurisdicción en la que opera, y tampoco puede evitar que los donantes de esperma donen en otro lugar durante sus vidas. Hay una aguda escasez de donantes de esperma en muchas partes del mundo y hay una presión obvia de muchos sectores para los espermatozoides de los donantes de aquellos que desean y pueden proporcionarlo para estar disponible de la manera más segura y libremente posible.

Title: Sperm donation laws by country
Content: In Israel, sperm donation is mandated by the Ministry of Health. There are 12 authorized sperm banks and hospitals across the country, and 2 more in private research facilities. Only unmarried, healthy men under the age of 30 are allowed to donate sperm, and they are financially compensated for it. Men who want to donate must get to the hospital, pass an interview and blood-checks. They are also prohibited from donating sperm in more than one sperm bank. Finally, anonymity is kept indefinitely; the donor would never receive information regarding offsprings, and vice versa.

While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.

Content: In October 22, 2,000 rebels were killed in the consequent Battle of Jajak Pass, the largest battle in Gangwon Province before the Korean War. The rebels lacked guns, and they used birch branches as weapons. They also lacked pots, and cooked rice over cattle hide. Because of the narrowness of the pass, the rebels were crowded, and it was easy for Maeng's troops to fire into the camp and kill rebels. Maeng himself reports that "it was impossible to see how many died", but descendants have given an estimate of 1,800~2,000. Descendants also report that the battle continued for three or four days. The Seonang Pass was renamed Jajak Pass, because the blood made a 'Jajak' sound as it rolled down the pass.

Title: Gona Barracks
Content: The former Gona Barracks is important in demonstrating the pattern of Queensland's history as evidence of Queensland's preparations for military involvement in various world conflicts. Specifically, Gona Barracks is associated with the expansion of military training for militia forces after the introduction of compulsory military training in 1911, the provision of facilities for specialist militia units, and the continuation of voluntary military forces until 1998. The place contains World War I drill halls built for militia units of infantry, and more specialised groups such as the artillery, engineers and service corps, and as such demonstrates the extent of the various sections of the armed forces at the time and the commitment of the citizen soldiers who composed these units. The general size of the barracks site also demonstrates the site's early history as the Brisbane Grammar School endowment, from 1879 to 1911.

Title: Tylenol (marca)
Content: La marca fue presentada en 1955 por McNeil Laboratories, un fabricante farmacéutico de propiedad familiar. Dos hermanos se hicieron cargo de la compañía de su padre ese año, y ese año uno de ellos aprendió sobre el paracetamol, que no estaba en el mercado estadounidense en ese momento. Para evitar competir con la aspirina, lo comercializaron como un producto para reducir la fiebre en los niños, empaquetándola como un camión de bomberos rojo con el eslogan, "para pequeños cascos". El nombre "Tylenol" y el nombre genérico "acetaminofeno" fueron generados por McNeil a partir del nombre químico del fármaco. Johnson & Johnson compraron McNeil en 1959, y un año después la droga se puso a disposición del mostrador.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Burson-Marsteller
Content: At a Burson-Marsteller organized press conference in November 1982, Johnson & Johnson introduced new tamper-proof packaging, becoming the first company to introduce triple-sealed packaging, which later became the industry standard. The conference gave Johnson & Johnson the opportunity to announce that they were reintroducing Tylenol capsules to the market and would replace any Tylenol that consumers had thrown away. In addition, Johnson & Johnson published advertisements with coupons for consumers to use in replacing Tylenol that had been thrown out and produced commercials and print advertisements thanking the public for their "continuing confidence and support". Within six weeks of the introduction of the repackaged product Tylenol's sales returned to the previous level. In 1983, Burson-Marsteller was awarded a Silver Anvil for "out-of-the-ordinary crisis management" for its work with Johnson & Johnson. The company was brought back to handle crisis management during a second Tylenol crisis, involving cyanide tainting in New York in 1986.

Title: Dígito numérico
Content: Desde la India, el comercio próspero entre los sultanes islámicos y África llevó el concepto a El Cairo. Los matemáticos árabes extendieron el sistema para incluir fracciones decimales, y Muḥammad ibn mūsā al-ḵwārizmī escribió un trabajo importante al respecto en el siglo IX. Los números árabes modernos se introdujeron a Europa con la traducción de este trabajo en el siglo XII en España y Leonardo de "Liber Abaci" de Pisa de 1201. En Europa, el sistema indio completo con los cero se derivó de los árabes en el siglo XII.

Document ID: 2
Title: Arabic numerals
Content: The Hindu-Arabic numeral system was developed by Indian mathematicians around AD 500 using quite different forms of the numerals. From India, the system was adopted by Arabic mathematicians in Baghdad and passed on to the Arabs farther west. The current form of the numerals developed in North Africa. It was in the North African city of Bejaia that the Italian scholar Fibonacci first encountered the numerals; his work was crucial in making them known throughout Europe. The use of Arabic numerals spread around the world through European trade, books and colonialism.

Document ID: 2
Title: Warren B. Hamilton
Content: Hamilton led a two-man field party in Antarctica (October 1958–January 1959) for the International Geophysical Year, and launched a new understanding of Antarctica. He was the first to apply the name trans-Antarctic Mountains (two years later, formalized as Transantarctic Mountains) to that 3,500 km range. Hamilton recognized that a large sector of this range contained distinctive granitic rocks like South Australia's Adelaide orogenic belt. Associated fossils of diverse ages in Antarctica, Australia, and southernmost Africa further linked these continents, and supported then-radical explanations of continental drift. Before traveling to Antarctica, Hamilton was what he later described as a "closet drifter," aware that Southern Hemisphere geology provided powerful evidence favoring continental drift. He returned to Antarctica for fieldwork in 1963 and 1964 in other parts of the Transantarctic Mountains, including those once continuous with other Australian tracts. He also investigated in the field evidence for drift in Australia and South Africa, integrating his work with that of other researchers to show how Antarctica and other Gondwana continents had drifted apart.

En 2005, Centipede Press lanzó una edición limitada de Deluxe de "'Salem's Lot" con fotografías en blanco y negro de Jerry Uelsmann y las dos historias cortas "Jerusalén's Lot" y "One for the Road", así como más de 50 páginas de material eliminado. El libro se limitó a 315 copias, cada una firmada por Stephen King y Jerry Uelsmann. El libro se imprimió en 100# papel superfino Mohawk, medido, tenía más grueso y pesaba más que. El libro incluía un marcador de cinta, bandas de cabeza y cola, construcción de telas de tres piezas y un estuche. Más tarde se lanzó una edición de tapa dura sin firmar a 600 copias. Se agotaron tanto las ediciones firmadas como sin firmar. En una entrevista con el diario de comercio impreso "Fine Books & Collections", King dijo sobre la versión ilustrada de Folio de su "'Lote de Salem", "¡Creo que es hermoso!" Más tarde se lanzó una edición comercial.

Title: The Cat in the Hat
Content: According to Judith and Neil Morgan, the book sold well immediately. The trade edition initially sold an average of 12,000 copies a month, a figure which rose rapidly. Bullock's department store in Los Angeles, California, sold out of its first, 100-copy order of the book in a day and quickly reordered 250 more. The Morgans attribute these sales numbers to "playground word-of-mouth", asserting that children heard about the book from their friends and nagged their parents to buy it for them. However, Houghton Mifflin's school edition did not sell as well. As Geisel noted in Jonathan Cott's 1983 profile of him, "Houghton Mifflin... had trouble selling it to the schools; there were a lot of Dick and Jane devotees, and my book was considered too fresh and irreverent. But Bennett Cerf at Random House had asked for trade rights, and it just took off in the bookstores." Geisel told the Morgans, "Parents understood better than school people the necessity for this kind of reader."

Title: National Debt Clock
Content: The idea of conveying a message through a periodically updated clock found an earlier expression in the Doomsday Clock. However, the innovation of the National Debt Clock was to feature a constantly running counter; it has since inspired similar projects elsewhere, both in the United States and further afield. In particular, it has become a national fixture shows that the U.S.'s increasing debt. By 1995, the "New York Times" reported that politicians were citing the clock to advocate for a reduction to the national budget. Various tracking counters of national debt are also kept online.

claim: Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion
question_en: Does cognitive dissonance factor into pluralistic ignorance?
report_en: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context. Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1]. Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1]. Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
all_claims: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context.

Title: Ignorancia pluralista
Content: Prentice y Miller descubrieron que, en promedio, los niveles privados de comodidad con las prácticas de consumo de alcohol en el campus eran mucho más bajos que el promedio percibido. En el caso de los hombres, encontraron un cambio de actitudes privadas hacia esta norma percibida, una forma de disonancia cognitiva. Se descubrió que las mujeres, por otro lado, tenían una mayor sensación de alienación en el campus, pero carecían del cambio de actitud detectado en los hombres, presumiblemente porque las normas relacionadas con el consumo de alcohol en el campus son mucho más centrales para los hombres que para las mujeres. La investigación ha demostrado que la ignorancia pluralista plaga no solo a aquellos que se entregan, sino también a aquellos que se abstienen: de los juegos de azar, fumar y beber y entre algunos que siguen el vegetarianismo. Este último ha encontrado que la ignorancia pluralista puede ser causada por la estructura de la red social subyacente, no la disonancia cognitiva.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Interpersonal communication
Content: When individuals encounter new information or new experiences, they categorize the information based on their preexisting attitudes, thoughts, and beliefs. If the new encounter does not coincide with their preexisting assumptions, then dissonance is likely to occur. When dissonance does occur, individuals are motivated to reduce the dissonance they experience by avoiding situations that would either cause the dissonance or increase the dissonance. For this reason, cognitive dissonance is considered a drive state that encourages motivation to achieve consonance and reduce dissonance.
An example of cognitive dissonance would be if someone holds the belief that maintaining a healthy lifestyle is important, but they don't regularly work out or eat healthy. They may experience dissonance between their beliefs and their actions. If there is a significant amount of dissonance, they may be motivated to change their attitudes and work out more or eat healthier foods. They may also be inclined to avoid situations that will point out the fact that their attitudes and beliefs are inconsistent, such as avoiding the gym or not reading health reports.According to cognitive dissonance theory, there are three types of cognitive relationships: consonant relationships, dissonant relationships, and irrelevant relationships. Consonant relationships are when two elements, such as your beliefs and actions, are in equilibrium with each other or coincide. Dissonant relationships are when two elements are not in equilibrium and cause dissonance. Irrelevant relationships are when two elements do not possess a meaningful relationship with one another, they are unrelated and do not cause dissonance.

Title: Kathleen Beedles
Content: From 1999 to 2001, Beedles worked as a story associate on "Coronation Street" before moving onto "Emmerdale" as Story Editor. In 2005, Beedles was appointed Series Producer of British television soap opera "Emmerdale", taking over from Steve Frost. She had worked as a producer and series editor for the ITV soap before taking on the role.During her time on the soap, she was responsible for many major storylines, including the Kings River showhome explosion storyline, and the Tom King kidnap plot. She was also responsible for the Who Killed Tom King? storyline, which was nominated for Best Storyline at the 2007 British Soap Awards. Under her tenure Emmerdale was nominated for a BAFTA for three consecutive years, won an RTS Award and the Broadcast Digital Award for the Who Killed Tom King online channel.

Title: Wilt Chamberlain
Content: Wilton Norman Chamberlain (; 21 de agosto de 1936 - 12 de octubre de 1999) fue un jugador de baloncesto estadounidense que jugó una posición central y es considerado uno de los jugadores más prominentes y dominantes en la historia de la NBA. Jugó para los Guerreros de Filadelfia/San Francisco, los Philadelphia 76ers y los Lakers de Los Ángeles de la Asociación Nacional de Baloncesto (NBA). Jugó para la Universidad de Kansas y también para los Harlem Globetrotters antes de jugar en la NBA. Chamberlain se puso de pie y pesaba como novato antes de aumentar hasta 275 y finalmente a los Lakers.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Wilt Chamberlain
Content: Wilton Norman Chamberlain was born in Philadelphia, into a family of nine children, the son of Olivia Ruth Johnson, a domestic worker and homemaker, and William Chamberlain, a welder, custodian, and handyman. He was a frail child, nearly dying of pneumonia in his early years and missing a whole year of school as a result. In his early years Chamberlain was not interested in basketball, because he thought it was "a game for sissies". Instead, he was an avid track and field athlete: as a youth, he high jumped 6 feet, 6 inches, ran the 440 yards in 49.0 seconds and the 880 yards in 1:58.3, put the shot 53 feet, 4 inches, and broad jumped 22 feet. But according to Chamberlain, "basketball was king in Philadelphia", so he eventually turned to the sport. Because Chamberlain was a very tall child, already measuring at age 10 and when he entered Philadelphia's Overbrook High School, he had a natural advantage against his peers; he soon was renowned for his scoring talent, his physical strength and his shot blocking abilities. According to ESPN journalist Hal Bock, Chamberlain was "scary, flat-out frightening... before he came along, most basketball players were mortal-sized men. Chamberlain changed that." It was also in this period of his life when his three lifelong nicknames "Wilt the Stilt", "Goliath", and his favorite, "The Big Dipper", were allegedly born.
---

Title: Georgios Papadopoulos
Content: Papadopoulos nació en Elaiohori, un pequeño pueblo en la prefectura de Achaea en Peloponeso, a la maestra de escuela local Christos Papadopoulos y su esposa Chrysoula. Era el hijo mayor y tenía dos hermanos, Konstantinos y Haralambos. Después de terminar la escuela secundaria en 1937, se matriculó en la Academia Militar Helénica, completando su programa de tres años en 1940.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Georgios Papadopoulos
Content: Translated as:
A failed assassination attempt against Papadopoulos was perpetrated by Alexandros Panagoulis in the morning of 13 August 1968, when Papadopoulos was driven from his summer residence in Lagonisi to Athens, escorted by his personal security motorcycles and cars. Panagoulis ignited a bomb at a point of the coastal road where the limousine carrying Papadopoulos would have to slow down, but the bomb failed to harm Papadopoulos. Panagoulis was captured a few hours later in a nearby sea cave, since the boat sent to help him escape was instructed to leave at a specific time and he couldn't swim there on time due to strong sea currents. After his arrest, he was taken to the Greek Military Police (EAT-ESA) offices where he was questioned, beaten and tortured. On 17 November 1968, Panagoulis was sentenced to death but was personally pardoned by Papadopoulos, served only five years in prison, and after democracy was restored was elected a member of Parliament. He was regarded as an emblematic figure of the struggle to restore democracy, and as such has often been paralleled to Harmodius and Aristogeiton, two ancient Athenians known for their assassination tyrannicide of Hipparchus.

Title: Ácido 5-hidroxyeicosatetraenoico
Content: El Premio Nobel, Bengt I. Samuelsson, y sus colegas describieron por primera vez 5 ("S")-Hete en 1976 como un metabolito de ácido araquidónico hecho por neutrófilos de conejo. La actividad biológica se vinculó varios años después, cuando se descubrió que estimulaba los aumentos de neutrófilos humanos en calcio citosólico, quimiotaxis y aumenta en la adhesividad de su superficie celular como lo indican su agregación entre sí. Dado que un metabolito de ácido araquidónico descubierto previamente realizado por neutrófilos, leucotrieno B4 (LTB) también estimula los aumentos de calcio de neutrófilos humanos, la quimiotaxis y la auto-agregación y es estructuralmente similar a 5 ("S"). 5-("S")-Hete estimuló las células a través de los mismos receptores de la superficie celular que los utilizados por (LTB) a saber, los receptores de leucotrienos B4. Sin embargo, otros estudios en neutrófilos indicaron que 5-("S")-Hete actúa a través de un receptor distinto del utilizado por LTB, así como varios otros estímulos de neutrófilos. Este receptor 5 ("S")-Hete se denomina receptor 1 oxoeicosanoides (abreviado como (Oxer1).
---

Title: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid
Content: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (5-HETE, 5("S")-HETE, or 5"S"-HETE) is an eicosanoid, i.e. a metabolite of arachidonic acid. It is produced by diverse cell types in humans and other animal species. These cells may then metabolize the formed 5("S")-HETE to 5-oxo-eicosatetraenoic acid (5-oxo-ETE), 5("S"),15("S")-dihydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (5("S"),15("S")-diHETE), or 5-oxo-15-hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (5-oxo-15("S")-HETE).
---

Title: Chlorine
Content: Chlorine is a chemical element with symbol Cl and atomic number 17. The second-lightest of the halogens, it appears between fluorine and bromine in the periodic table and its properties are mostly intermediate between them. Chlorine is a yellow-green gas at room temperature. It is an extremely reactive element and a strong oxidising agent: among the elements, it has the highest electron affinity and the third-highest electronegativity, behind only oxygen and fluorine.

Title: Senado de Kazajstán
Content: El Senado de Kazajastan ("Qazaqstan Parlamentiniń Senaty") es la Cámara Alta de Dos cámaras en la legislatura de Kazajstán, conocida como el Parlamento ("Parlamenti"). El Senado está compuesto por miembros elegidos, dos de cada región, la ciudad de importancia republicana (Almaty) y la capital de la República de Kazajstán en las sesiones conjuntas de los miembros de todos los organismos representativos de las regiones respectivas, la ciudad de la importancia republicana y la ciudad capital de la República.
Los miembros del Senado son elegidos sobre la base del sufragio indirecto por votación secreta. La mitad de los miembros elegidos del Senado están a las elecciones cada tres años.
Quince miembros son nombrados por el presidente de Kazajstán con el objetivo de garantizar la representación de todos los diversos componentes nacionales y culturales de la sociedad.
El mandato para los miembros del Senado es de 6 años.
Según las normas constitucionales en el Parlamento de la Quinta Convocatoria, los miembros del Senado elegidos en 2011 y 2014 y los nombrados por el Presidente de la República de Kazajstán en 2011 y 2013 continúan ocupando un cargo.

Title: Teoría de la actividad (envejecimiento)
Content: La teoría de la actividad, también conocida como la teoría implícita del envejecimiento, la teoría normal del envejecimiento y la teoría laica del envejecimiento, propone que el envejecimiento exitoso ocurre cuando los adultos mayores permanecen activos y mantienen las interacciones sociales. Siente la opinión de que el proceso de envejecimiento se retrasa y la calidad de vida se mejora cuando las personas mayores permanecen socialmente activas. 
La teoría de la actividad aumentó en la respuesta opuesta a la teoría de la desconexión. La teoría de la actividad y la teoría de la desconexión fueron las dos teorías principales que describieron el envejecimiento exitoso a principios de la década de 1960. La teoría fue desarrollada por Robert J. Havighurst en 1961. En 1964, Bernice Neugarten afirmó que la satisfacción en la vejez dependía del mantenimiento activo de relaciones y esfuerzos personales.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Activity theory
Content: AT remained virtually unknown outside the Soviet Union until the mid-1980s, when it was picked up by Scandinavian researchers. The first international conference on activity theory was not held until 1986. The earliest non-Soviet paper cited by Nardi is a 1987 paper by Yrjö Engeström: "Learning by expanding". This resulted in a reformulation of AT. Kuutti notes that the term "activity theory" "can be used in two senses: referring to the original Soviet tradition or referring to the international, multi-voiced community applying the original ideas and developing them further."
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: En 1952, cuando la Asociación de Brewing de San Antonio cambió su nombre a Pearl Brewing Company, el Triple XS se unió al nombre de Pearl como una imagen dominante en el producto y la compañía en su conjunto. El Triple XS volvió al logotipo de la compañía y se usaron en casi todos los anuncios de Pearl. El XS desempeñó este importante papel hasta el final de la producción en la cervecería en 2001, cuando la cervecería cerró sus puertas y el logotipo de la compañía fue abandonado. A medida que la producción de Light Pearl y Pearl giró en las instalaciones de Miller's Fort Worth, los logotipos del producto fueron rediseñados. La etiqueta actualizada no utiliza el triple XS, por lo que una parte importante de la identidad de la empresa se ha eliminado prácticamente de las cervezas de perlas. Sin embargo, Pearl's Country Club Malt Liquor todavía muestra los XXXs en su logotipo.
Muchas personas se preguntan de dónde vinieron el XS y cómo se usaron en la cerveza. En verdad, las tres X son en realidad un sistema de calificación de calidad. El sistema se usó inicialmente en Europa durante el siglo XVI. A medida que la realeza europea viajaba sus tierras y visitaba los condados vecinos, se envió un mensajero real por delante de la fiesta oficial. El trabajo de The Courier consistía en probar cerveza en las posadas en el camino. Si la cerveza fuera solo promedio, el mensajero marcaría el letrero o la puerta de la posada con una sola X. Si la cerveza de la posada se considerara buena, el letrero o la puerta recibirían dos X. Una marca en una posada de tres X significaba que la cerveza en el interior era excelente, y una parada obligada para la corte real al pasar.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: The triple Xs were adopted by the San Antonio Brewing Association to portray two things: the high quality of their beers, and the pride that workers put into their products. The triple Xs may be gone from company and Pearl beer logos, but it has not completely vanished. In the 1960s, Pearl absorbed the Goetz Brewing Company and made Country Club Malt Liquor one of Pearl's key products. When Country Club received its only product makeover a few years after the buyout, it gained the triple Xs in its logo. The Xs were situated in the top-center of the logo's crown. Country Club is still produced today, and it still carries the “xXx” mark of Pearl.
---

claim: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion
question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
report_en: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1]. When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1]. Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1]. Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].

Title: Lesión nerviosa
Content: La cirugía se puede hacer en caso de que un nervio se haya cortado o dividido de otra manera. La recuperación de un nervio después de la reparación quirúrgica depende principalmente de la edad del paciente. Los niños pequeños pueden recuperar la función nerviosa cercana a la normalidad. En contraste, un paciente mayor de 60 años con un nervio cortado en la mano esperaría recuperar solo la sensación de protección, es decir, la capacidad de distinguir el calor/frío o afilado/opaco. Muchos otros factores también afectan la recuperación nerviosa. El uso de procedimientos de injerto nervioso autólogo que implican la redirección de las fibras nerviosas donantes regenerativas en el conducto del injerto ha tenido éxito en la restauración de la función muscular objetivo. La entrega localizada de factores neurotróficos solubles puede ayudar a promover la tasa de regeneración del axón observada dentro de estos conductos de injerto.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Neurolytic block
Content: A neurolytic block is a form of nerve block involving the deliberate injury of a nerve by freezing or heating ("neurotomy") or the application of chemicals ("neurolysis"). These interventions cause degeneration of the nerve's fibers and temporary (a few months, usually) interference with the transmission of nerve signals. In these procedures, the thin protective layer around the nerve fiber, the basal lamina, is preserved so that, as a damaged fiber regrows, it travels within its basal lamina tube and connects with the correct loose end, and function may be restored. Surgical cutting of a nerve (neurectomy), severs these basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, over time a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is usually preferred over the surgical block.
---

Title: Neurolytic block
Content: A neurolytic block is a form of nerve block involving the deliberate injury of a nerve by freezing or heating ("neurotomy") or the application of chemicals ("neurolysis"). These interventions cause degeneration of the nerve's fibers and temporary (a few months, usually) interference with the transmission of nerve signals. In these procedures, the thin protective layer around the nerve fiber, the basal lamina, is preserved so that, as a damaged fiber regrows, it travels within its basal lamina tube and connects with the correct loose end, and function may be restored. Surgical cutting of a nerve (neurectomy), severs these basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, over time a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is usually preferred over the surgical block.
---

question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
report_en: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1]. When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1]. Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1]. Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].

Pythagorean triples occur when all three sides of a right triangle are integers such as a = 3, b = 4 and c = 5. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Dentadura postiza
Content: La fabricación de un conjunto de dentaduras postizas completas es un desafío para cualquier dentista/denturista. Hay muchos axiomas en la producción de dentaduras postizas que deben entenderse; La ignorancia de un axioma puede conducir a la falla de la dentadura postiza. En la gran mayoría de los casos, las dentaduras postizas completas deben estar cómodas poco después de la inserción, aunque casi siempre se necesitan al menos dos visitas de ajuste para eliminar la causa de las manchas doloridas. Uno de los aspectos más críticos de las dentaduras postizas es que la impresión de la dentadura postiza debe hacerse y utilizar perfectamente con una técnica perfecta para hacer un modelo preciso de las encías edéntulas (sin dientes) del paciente. El dentista o el denturista deben usar un proceso llamado moldeo de borde para garantizar que las bridas de la dentadura postiza se extiendan adecuadamente. Puede ocurrir una variedad de problemas si la impresión final de la dentadura postiza no se realiza correctamente. Un dentista requiere una paciencia considerable para que un dentista sepa cómo hacer una dentadura postiza, y por esta razón puede ser lo mejor para el paciente buscar un especialista, ya sea un próstodoncista o denturista, para hacer la dentadura postiza. Un denturista es un profesional capacitado y con licencia que ve a los pacientes que necesitan dentaduras postizas, parciales, fijaciones o reparaciones. Un denturista no solo toma la impresión, sino que hace que toda la dentadura postiza en su propio laboratorio. El denturista luego programa una fecha para la entrega de las dentaduras postizas terminadas al paciente. Un dentista general puede hacer un buen trabajo haciendo dentaduras postizas, pero solo si es meticuloso y con experiencia. Muchos dentistas ya no hacen dentaduras postizas. Pero, en cambio, tenga una impresión de la boca de los pacientes y luego envíe las impresiones a un laboratorio dental, que podría estar en cualquier parte del mundo, o enviar al paciente a un denturista. Una vez que el laboratorio recibe impresiones dentales de la boca del paciente, el laboratorio le crea moldes de yeso. El laboratorio utiliza los moldes para crear las llantas de cera utilizadas para registrar la mordedura del paciente. Estas llantas de cera son devueltas al dentista, que los usa para registrar la mordida del paciente. El dentista puede ayudar al paciente a elegir el tamaño correcto de los dientes para las dentaduras postizas, o simplemente hacer la selección él mismo. Una vez que se completa el registro de la mordida y los dientes se seleccionan para las dentaduras postizas, el borde de la cera generalmente se devuelve al laboratorio dental para que los dientes de la dentadura postiza se coloquen en la cera. Una vez que los dientes se colocan en el borde de la cera, el resultado es una dentadura postiza prefincada que se parece casi al producto terminado. Esta dentadura postiza prefincuada generalmente se devuelve al consultorio del dentista y el paciente generalmente tiene la oportunidad de aprobar la configuración (para dentaduras postizas inmediatas o estándar) o probar la dentadura postiza antes de que se termine. Después de la aprobación del paciente, el dentista devuelve la dentadura previa al laboratorio para el procesamiento final. La dentadura dentada terminada se devuelve al consultorio del dentista para su entrega al paciente.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Denture cleaner
Content: A denture cleaner (also termed denture cleanser), is a cleaner used to clean dentures when they are out of the mouth. Their main use is to control the growth of microorganisms on the dentures, especially "Candida albicans", thereby preventing denture-related stomatitis. When dentures are worn in the mouth, a biofilm develops which may be similar to dental plaque. It may become hardened and mineralized as dental calculus. Denture cleansers are also used to remove stains and other debris that may be caused by diet, tobacco use, drinking coffee, drinking tea, etc.

question_en: Why do lions kill their own cubs?
report_en: Male–lion infanticide occurs chiefly when a new dominant male or coalition takes over a pride; by killing nursing cubs that are not his, he removes future rivals and, crucially, causes the mothers to stop lactating and return to estrus sooner, giving him an earlier chance to mate and pass on his own genes, so the behavior is favored by natural selection and persists in the population [1].

Title: Sociobiología
Content: Por ejemplo, los leones machos recién dominantes a menudo matan a los cachorros en el orgullo que no se dirigían. Este comportamiento es adaptativo porque matar a los Cachorros elimina la competencia por su propia descendencia y hace que las hembras de ancianos entren en calor más rápido, lo que permite que más de sus genes ingresen a la población. Los sociobiólogos verían que este comportamiento instintivo que mate los cachorros como heredado a través de los genes de reproducir con éxito leones machos, mientras que el comportamiento no matar puede haber desaparecido ya que esos leones tuvieron menos éxito en la reproducción.

Document ID: 2
Title: Lion
Content: When first introduced to the rest of the pride, lion cubs lack confidence when confronted with adults other than their mother. They soon begin to immerse themselves in the pride life, however, playing among themselves or attempting to initiate play with the adults. Lionesses with cubs of their own are more likely to be tolerant of another lioness's cubs than lionesses without cubs. Male tolerance of the cubs varies – sometimes a male will patiently let the cubs play with his tail or his mane, whereas another may snarl and bat the cubs away.
Weaning occurs after six or seven months. Male lions reach maturity at about three years of age and at four to five years are capable of challenging and displacing adult males associated with another pride. They begin to age and weaken at between 10 and 15 years of age at the latest. When one or more new males oust the previous males associated with a pride, the victors often kill any existing young cubs, perhaps because females do not become fertile and receptive until their cubs mature or die. Females often fiercely defend their cubs from a usurping male but are rarely successful unless a group of three or four mothers within a pride join forces against the male. Cubs also die from starvation and abandonment, and predation by leopards, hyenas and wild dogs. Up to 80% of lion cubs will die before the age of two.
---

Title: Nerf war
Content: A Nerf war is an activity involving Nerf Blasters or other foam-firing toy weapons. Nerf wars can be a wide range of games, from informal shootouts in offices and basements to well-organized outdoor battles with high-powered modified blasters. Since foam-firing guns are relatively safe and cheap, Nerf wars can include participants and battlefields otherwise unsuitable for airsoft and paintball.
Nerf wars can take place anywhere. Any area with a good balance of open space and cover can be a candidate. Basements, offices, and backyards are common locations for informal games. For larger wars with more participants, bigger venues like gymnasiums, public parks, forests, ravines, and schools make good playing areas. The inside of a large hall such as a room can may be turned into a battlefield by turning tables onto their sides. When planning a Nerf war in a public area, the organizer typically reserves the space and watches out for non-participants to reduce any liability. The ability to play in free locations is an important element of a Nerf war's accessibility.
---

Title: Red de programas de juegos
Content: Game Show Network lanzada a las 7:00 p.m. ET el 1 de diciembre de 1994. El primer programa de juegos transmitido fue "¿Cuál es mi línea?". Desde 1994 hasta aproximadamente 1997, la red emitió programas clásicos de juegos anteriores a 1972, así como espectáculos de juegos realizados después de 1972, la mayoría de los cuales provienen de la Biblioteca Mark Goodson-Bill Todman. La red emitió el juego en un ciclo de 24 horas, y también utilizó intersticiales en vivo como programación envolvente. En sus primeros meses, los comerciales de GSN consistieron en anuncios de servicios públicos (PSA), promociones para su programación y comerciales relacionados con la empresa matriz de red Sony. En 1995, cuando la red comenzó a expandirse, la red comenzó a aceptar la publicidad convencional a medida que obtuvo nuevos patrocinios. El 17 de marzo de 1997, la red de programas de juegos se renombró con un nuevo paquete de presentación y un nuevo logotipo (que tenía el nombre de la red en cajas y una colorida bola de remolino) y un nuevo eslogan "All Play, All Day". Si bien el logotipo cambió, su programación se mantuvo sin cambios, la red también debutó nuevas promociones y nuevos identificadores en ese día, que fueron diseñados por la agencia gráfica Lee Hunt Associates.

Title: Game Show Network
Content: On April 18, 1998, Game Show Network bought back the rights to the Goodson-Todman library. In late 1998, GSN eliminated all of its live programming, replacing them with in-show advertisements like "Win TV". In 1999, the network began a slate of original programming, including "Inquizition", "All New 3's a Crowd", and "Hollywood Showdown". The channel also launched original shows such as "Extreme Gong" (a remake of the classic "Gong Show"). In 2000, the network faced another setback when GSN lost the rights to broadcast "The Price Is Right", with the last episode airing on April 3 of that year.

Title: Drogas especializadas en los Estados Unidos
Content: Los medicamentos especializados o los productos farmacéuticos especiales son una designación reciente de productos farmacéuticos que se clasifican como de alto costo, alta complejidad y/o toque alto. Los medicamentos especializados son a menudo biológicos: "medicamentos derivados de células vivas" que son inyectables o infundidas (aunque algunos son medicamentos orales). Se utilizan para tratar afecciones crónicas complejas o raras como cáncer, artritis reumatoide, hemofilia, H.I.V. La psoriasis, la enfermedad inflamatoria intestinal y la hepatitis C. En 1990 había 10 medicamentos especializados en el mercado, a mediados de la década de 1990 había menos de 30, en 2008 había 200, y para 2015 había 300. Los medicamentos a menudo se definen como especialidades porque su precio es mucho más alto que el de los medicamentos sin pisos. Medicare define cualquier medicamento para el cual el precio negociado es de $ 670 por mes o más, como un medicamento especializado que se coloca en un nivel especializado que requiere un mayor costo compartido de pacientes. Los medicamentos también se identifican como especialidad cuando hay un requisito de manejo especial o el medicamento solo está disponible a través de una red de distribuciones limitadas. Para 2015, "los medicamentos especializados representaron un tercio de todos los gastos en drogas en los Estados Unidos, en comparación con el 19 por ciento en 2004 y se dirigieron hacia el 50 por ciento en los próximos 10 años", según IMS Health, que rastrea las prescripciones. Según un artículo de 2010 en Forbes, los medicamentos especializados para enfermedades raras se volvieron más caras "de lo que nadie imaginó" y su éxito se produjo "en un momento en que el negocio tradicional de drogas de vender medicamentos a las masas" estaba "en declive". En 2015, el análisis de "The Wall Street Journal" sugirió que la gran prima se debió al valor percibido de los tratamientos de enfermedades raras que generalmente son muy caras en comparación con los tratamientos para enfermedades más comunes.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Specialty drugs in the United States
Content: On September 27, 2007 President George W. Bush amended the Food and Drug Administration Amendments Act of 2007 (FDAAA) to authorize the FDA to require Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies (REMS) on medications if necessary to minimize the risks associated with some drugs". These medications were designated as specialty drugs and required specialty pharmacies. When the FDA approves a new drug they may require a REMS program which "may contain any combination of 5 criteria: Medication Guide, Communication Plan, Elements to Assure Safe Use, Implementation System, and Timetable for Submission of Assessments". "In 2010, 48% of all new molecular entities, and 60% of all new specialty drug approvals, required a REMS program." Risk-reduction mechanisms can include the "use of specialized distribution partners", special pharmacy.

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Historia de la región de Otago
Content: La fecha precisa en la que los primeros habitantes de Nueva Zelanda llegaron a Otago y el extremo sur (conocido por más tarde maorí como "Murihiku") sigue siendo incierto. Los maoríes descienden de una raza de caminés de marinas que, se mudaron del este de Asia y el sudeste de Asia a las islas del Pacífico. La tradición cuenta sus viajes adicionales desde Hawaiki hasta Nueva Zelanda, y algunos comentaristas han identificado esta patria como Havai'i, una isla en el grupo de la sociedad. La sobrepoblación, la escasez de alimentos y la guerra civil obligaron a muchos de ellos a migrar una vez más, y Nueva Zelanda se convirtió en su nuevo hogar. Los maorí se establecieron en Nueva Zelanda entre el año 1280-1320. Rápidamente aprendieron a cazar las numerosas especies de MOA y las focas en Nueva Zelanda y se establecieron en las Islas Norte y Sur en menos de unas pocas décadas. Hay un cambio en el registro de polen desde el interior de Otago de hace 600 años desde un bosque hasta la flora de Bracken. Se ha inferido que esto se relaciona con los incendios que se encienden durante la exploración maorí.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: History of New Zealand
Content: The history of New Zealand dates back at least 700 years to when it was discovered and settled by Polynesians, who developed a distinct Māori culture centred on kinship links and land. The first European explorer to sight New Zealand was Dutch navigator Abel Tasman on 13 December 1642. The Dutch were also the first non-natives to explore and chart New Zealand's coastline. Captain James Cook, who reached New Zealand in October 1769 on the first of his three voyages, was the first European explorer to circumnavigate and map New Zealand. From the late 18th century, the country was regularly visited by explorers and other sailors, missionaries, traders and adventurers. In 1840 the Treaty of Waitangi was signed between the British Crown and various Māori chiefs, bringing New Zealand into the British Empire and giving Māori the same rights as British subjects. There was extensive British settlement throughout the rest of the century and into the early part of the next century. War and the imposition of a European economic and legal system led to most of New Zealand's land passing from Māori to Pākehā (European) ownership, and most Māori subsequently became impoverished.
---

Entre sus innovaciones se incluyen las formaciones de ala simple y doble (precursores de las formaciones modernas de propagación y escopeta), la postura de tres puntos y la técnica de bloqueo del cuerpo. El compañero entrenador pionero Amos Alonzo Stagg calificó a Warner "uno de los excelentes creadores". Fue incluido como entrenador en el Salón de la Fama del Fútbol College como parte de su clase inaugural en 1951. También contribuyó a un programa de fútbol junior que se conoció como Pop Warner Little Scholars, una popular organización de fútbol americano juvenil.

Content: Warner was the brother of famed football coach Pop Warner. In 1902, Bill and Glenn both played pro football for the Syracuse Athletic Club during the first World Series of Football, held at Madison Square Garden. It was during this event, that Warner played in the very first professional indoor football game as his Syracuse squad upset the heavily favored "New York" team. While Glenn was injured during the event with a head injury, Bill and the rest of the Syracuse team went on to win the event.

Title: Bate de cricket
Content: La "cuchilla" de un murciélago de cricket es un bloque de madera que generalmente es plano en la cara llamativa y con una cresta en el reverso (atrás) que concentra la madera en el medio donde generalmente se golpea la pelota. El murciélago está hecha tradicionalmente de madera de sauce, específicamente de una variedad de sauces blancos llamado cricket bat willow ("salix alba" var. "Caerulea"), tratada con aceite de linaza crudo (sin hervir), que tiene una función protectora. Esta variedad de sauce se usa, ya que es muy resistente y resistente a los choques, no está significativamente abollado ni astillado en el impacto de una bola de cricket a alta velocidad, al tiempo que tiene un peso ligero. La cara del bate a menudo está cubierta con una película protectora por el usuario.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Laws of Cricket
Content: "Law 5: The bat". The bat is no more than in length, no more than wide, no more than deep at its middle and no deeper than at the edge. The hand or glove holding the bat is considered part of the bat. Ever since the ComBat incident, a highly publicised marketing attempt by Dennis Lillee, who brought out an aluminium bat during an international game, the Laws have provided that the blade of the bat must be made of wood.
"Law 6: The pitch". The pitch is a rectangular area of the ground long and wide. The Ground Authority selects and prepares the pitch, but once the game has started, the umpires control what happens to the pitch. Title: Northern Isles
Content: The Northern Isles (; ; ) are a pair of archipelagos off the north coast of mainland Scotland, comprising Orkney and Shetland. The climate is cool and temperate and much influenced by the surrounding seas. There are a total of 26 inhabited islands with landscapes of the fertile agricultural islands of Orkney contrasting with the more rugged Shetland islands to the north, where the economy is more dependent on fishing and the oil wealth of the surrounding seas. Both have a developing renewable energy industry. They also share a common Pictish and Norse history. Both island groups were absorbed into the Kingdom of Scotland in the 15th century and remained part of the country following the formation of the Kingdom of Great Britain in 1707, and later the United Kingdom after 1801. Title: Kenneth Whiting
Content: Whiting sometimes is referred to as the U.S. Navys "father of the aircraft carrier." He had begun agitating for U.S. Navy development of what were then called "plane carriers" in the spring of 1916, and as early as March 1917 he had proposed to United States Secretary of the Navy Josephus Daniels that the Navy acquire a ship with an aircraft catapult and a flight deck, prompting the first serious U.S. Navy consideration of the acquisition of any kind of aviation ship since the American Civil War of 1861–1865. The United States Department of the Navy rejected his proposal on 20 June 1917. In the years between World War I and World War II, however, Whiting would be instrumental in the construction of five of the U.S. Navys first six aircraft carriers and serve as executive officer of its first two. He also served as acting commanding officer of its first carrier at a time when the United States was experimenting with many aspects of the operation of aircraft carriers and their aircraft.

claim: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins
question_en: What happens when the president and VP of the USA die?
report_en: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency. If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1]. Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
all_claims: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency.

If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
claims_retained: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].

However, for nearly 20% of U.S. history, there has been no vice president in office who can assume the presidency.

claim: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation
question_en: Does Buddhism believe in Jesus?
report_en: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1]. While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1]. Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
all_claims: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
claims_retained: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

Title: Budismo y cristianismo
Content: Aunque se han dibujado analogías entre el budismo y el cristianismo, existen diferencias entre las dos religiones que comienzan con el lugar del monoteísmo en el centro del cristianismo, y la orientación del budismo hacia el no teísmo (la falta de relevancia de la existencia de una deidad creadora) que va en contra de las enseñanzas sobre Dios en el cristianismo; y extendiéndose a la importancia de la gracia en el cristianismo contra el rechazo de la interferencia con el karma en el budismo de Theravada, etc. Otra diferencia entre las dos tradiciones es la creencia cristiana en la centralidad de la crucifixión de Jesús como un solo evento que se cree que actúa como la expiación de los pecados y su contraste directo con las enseñanzas buddhistas.

Title: Shinji Takahashi (religious leader)
Content: Takahashi preached that Buddhism and Christianity in the present age have become academic, or formalized, and changed into a faith based on other powers. In response to this, he advocated returning to the times of Gotama Siddhartha and Jesus Christ in many of his literary works, starting with “"Ningen/Shaka"” (“Human Beings/Gotama Buddha”). In addition, Takahashi emphasized that neither Jesus Christ nor Gotama Siddhartha preached the thoughts of other powers at all, and that Christianity and Buddhism in their respective times were not complicated like the Christianity and Buddhism of today. With regard to the thoughts of other powers influencing these religions, these laws of nature (the pure religious base of Buddhism, Islam, and Christianity) transformed as a result of the intentions of those who were in power over time, as well as the interpretations of the many scholars; the cores of these laws of nature were lost, various theories became mixed, and they became academized in a complex manner and lost their substance. In addition, these laws of nature were intentionally distorted and conveyed to people for the purpose of individual's own benefit, and people were made to believe that those who obstructed this would be met with strict counteractions. This new set of distorted laws were slowly deemed as being the laws of nature as taught in today's versions of those religions.
---

Title: Idioma español
Content: La Asociación de Academias de Lengua Española (o) es la entidad que regula el idioma español. Fue creado en México en 1951 y representa la unión de todas las academias separadas en el mundo de habla hispana. Comprende las academias de 23 países, ordenadas por fecha de la Fundación de la Academia: España (1713), Colombia (1871), Ecuador (1874), México (1875), El Salvador (1876), Venezuela (1883), Chile (1885), Perú (1887), Guatemala (1887), Costo Rica (1923). (1924), Panamá (1926), Cuba (1926),
Paraguay (1927), República Dominicana (1927), Bolivia (1927), Nicaragua (1928), Argentina (1931), Uruguay (1943), Honduras (1949), Puerto Rico (1955), Estados Unidos (1973) y Guinea Ecatorial (2016).
El (Instituto de Cervantes) es una organización sin fines de lucro mundial creada por el gobierno español en 1991. Esta organización se ha ramificado en más de 20 países diferentes, con 54 centros dedicados a las culturas e hispanohames hispanos e hispanos. Los objetivos finales del Instituto son promover universalmente la educación, el estudio y el uso del español como segundo idioma, apoyar métodos y actividades que ayudan al proceso de educación en español, y contribuir al avance de las culturas españolas e hispanas estadounidenses en países no de habla espectacular. El informe del Instituto 2015 "El Español, Una Lengua Viva" (español, un idioma vivo) estima que hay 559 millones de hablantes de español en todo el mundo. Entre las fuentes citadas en el informe se encuentra la Oficina del Censo de EE. UU., Que estima que Estados Unidos tendrá 138 millones de hispanohablantes para 2050, lo que la convierte en la nación de habla española más grande de la tierra, con español la lengua materna de casi un tercio de sus ciudadanos.

Title: Nicaraguans
Content: Spanish is spoken by about 90% of the country's population. In Nicaragua the Voseo form is common, just as in other countries in Central and South America like Honduras, Argentina, Uruguay or coastal Colombia. Spanish has many different dialects spoken throughout Latin America, Central American Spanish is the dialect spoken in Nicaragua. In the Caribbean coast many afro-Nicaraguans and creoles speak English and creole English as their first language. Also in the Caribbean coast, many Indigenous people speak their native languages, such as the Miskito, Sumo, Rama and Garifuna language. In addition, many ethnic groups in Nicaragua, such as the Chinese Nicaraguans and Palestinian Nicaraguans, have maintained their ancestral languages, which are minority languages, while also speaking Spanish and/or English. These minority languages include Chinese, Arabic, German, and Italian, among others.

Title: Lin Biao
Content: Lin Biao (December 5, 1907 – September 13, 1971) was a Marshal of the People's Republic of China who was pivotal in the Communist victory in the Chinese Civil War, especially in Northeast China. Lin was the general who commanded the decisive Liaoshen and Pingjin Campaigns, in which he co-led the Manchurian Field Army to victory and led the People's Liberation Army into Beijing. He crossed the Yangtze River in 1949, decisively defeated the Kuomintang and took control of the coastal provinces in Southeast China. He ranked third among the Ten Marshals. Zhu De and Peng Dehuai were considered senior to Lin, and Lin ranked directly ahead of He Long and Liu Bocheng.

Es una de las especies más grandes de búho, y las hembras pueden crecer a una longitud total de 75 cm (30 pulgadas), con una envergadura de 188 cm (6 pies 2 pulgadas), siendo los machos ligeramente más pequeños. Title: Eurasian eagle-owl
Content: The Eurasian eagle-owl is a very large bird, smaller than the golden eagle ("Aquila chrysaetos") but larger than the snowy owl, despite some overlap in size with both species. It is sometimes referred to as the world's largest owl, although Blakiston's fish owl ("B. blakistoni") is slightly heavier on average and the much lighter weight great grey owl ("Strix nebulosa") is slightly longer on average. Heimo Mikkola reported the largest specimens of eagle-owl as having the same upper body mass, , as the largest Blakiston’s fish owl and attained a length of around longer. In terms of average weight and wing size, the Blakiston’s is the slightly larger species seemingly, even averaging a bit larger in these aspects than the biggest eagle-owl races from Russia. Also, although shorter than the largest of the latter species, the Eurasian eagle-owl can weigh well more than twice as much as the largest great grey owl. The Eurasian eagle-owl typically has a wingspan of , with the largest specimens possibly attaining . The total length of the species can vary from . Females can weigh from and males can weigh from . In comparison, the barn owl ("Tyto alba"), the world's most widely distributed owl species, weighs about 500 g (1.1 lb) and the great horned owl ("Bubo virginianus"), which fills the eagle-owl's ecological niche in North America, weighs around 1.4 kg (3.1 lb).

Title: SS Great Eastern
Content: SS "Great Eastern" fue un vapor de navegación de hierro diseñado por Isambard Kingdom Brunel, y construido por J. Scott Russell & Co. en Millwall Iron Works en River Thames, Londres. Ella era, con mucho, el barco más grande jamás construido en el momento de su lanzamiento de 1858, y tenía la capacidad de transportar 4.000 pasajeros desde Inglaterra a Australia sin reabastecer. Su longitud solo fue superada en 1899 por los 17,274 rms-goss-tonel "oceanic", su tonelaje bruto de 18,915 solo fue superado en 1901 por el "035-toneladas de grosor" celtas "y su capacidad de 4.000 pasajeros fue superada en 1913 por el" imperator SS "SS" P-Phishenger "de 4,935 pasajeros". Los cinco embudos del barco eran raros. Más tarde se redujeron a cuatro.

Document ID: 2
Title: SS Great Eastern
Content: An early example of breaking-up a structure by use of a wrecking ball, she was scrapped at New Ferry on the River Mersey by Henry Bath & Son Ltd in 1889–1890 – it took 18 months to take her apart. At the time Everton Football Club were looking for a flagpole for their Anfield ground, and consequently purchased her top mast. It still stands there today at the ground - now owned by Liverpool Football Club (formed 1892), at the Kop end. In 2011, the Channel 4 programme "Time Team" found geophysical survey evidence to suggest that residual iron parts from the ship's keel and lower structure still reside in the foreshore.
During 1859, when "Great Eastern" was off Portland conducting trials, an explosion aboard blew off one of the funnels. The funnel was salvaged and subsequently purchased by the water company supplying Weymouth and Melcombe Regis in Dorset, UK, and used as a filtering device. It was later transferred to the Bristol Maritime Museum close to Brunel's SS "Great Britain" then moved to the SS "Great Britain" museum.

prompt:

Title: Jonathan Swift
Content: Jonathan Swift nació el 30 de noviembre de 1667 en Dublín, Irlanda. Era el segundo hijo y el único hijo de Jonathan Swift (1640-1667) y su esposa Abigail Erick (o Herrick) de Frisby en el Wreake. Su padre era originario de Goodrich, Herefordshire, pero acompañó a sus hermanos a Irlanda para buscar su fortuna en la ley después de que la propiedad de su padre realista fue llevado a la ruina durante la Guerra Civil inglesa. Su abuelo materno, James Ericke, era el vicario de Thornton, Inglaterra. En 1634, el vicario fue condenado por prácticas puritanas. En algún momento, Ericke y su familia, incluida su pequeña hija Abilgail, huyeron a Irlanda.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: A Tale of a Tub
Content: Born of English parents in Ireland, Jonathan Swift was working as Sir William Temple's secretary at the time he composed "A Tale of a Tub" (1694–1697). The publication of the work coincided with Swift's striking out on his own, having despaired of getting a good "living" from Temple or Temple's influence. There is speculation about what caused the rift between Swift and his employer, but, as A. C. Elias persuasively argues, it seems that the final straw came with Swift's work on Temple's "Letters." Swift had been engaged to translate Temple's French correspondence, but Temple, or someone close to Temple, edited the French text to make Temple seem both prescient and more fluent. Consequently, the letters and the translations Swift provided did not gibe, and, since Swift could not accuse Temple of falsifying his letters, and because the public would never believe that the retired state minister had lied, Swift came across as incompetent.
Even though Swift published the "Tale" as he left Temple's service, it was conceived earlier, and the book is a salvo in one of Temple's battles. Swift's general polemic concerns an argument (the "Quarrel of the Ancients and the Moderns") that had been over for nearly ten years by the time the book was published. The "Quarrel of the Ancients and Moderns" was a French academic debate of the early 1690s, occasioned by Fontenelle arguing that modern scholarship had allowed modern man to surpass the ancients in knowledge. Temple argued against this position in his "On Ancient and Modern Learning" (where he provided the first English formulation of the commonplace that modern critics see more only because they are dwarves standing on the shoulders of giants), and Temple's somewhat naive essay prompted a small flurry of responses. Among others, two men who took the side opposing Temple were Richard Bentley (classicist and editor) and William Wotton (critic).
---

La profundidad promedio del lago es de 46 brazas de 3 pies (279 pies; 85 m), mientras que su mayor profundidad es de 153 brazas de 5 pies (923 pies; 281 m). La región más profunda del lago Michigan, que se encuentra en su medio norte, se llama cuenca de Chippewa (que lleva el nombre del lago prehistórico Chippewa) y está separada de la cuenca del sur de Chippewa, por un área relativamente menos menos profunda llamada Mid Lake Plateau.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Nervio óptico
Content: El nervio óptico deja la órbita (zócalos oculares) a través del canal óptico, que se ejecuta postero-medialmente hacia el quiasma óptico, donde hay una decusación parcial (cruce) de fibras de los campos visuales temporales (el hemi-retina nasal) de ambos ojos. La proporción de fibras decusantes varía entre las especies y se correlaciona con el grado de visión binocular que disfruta una especie. La mayoría de los axones del nervio óptico terminan en el núcleo geniculado lateral desde donde la información se transmite a la corteza visual, mientras que otros axones terminan en el núcleo pretectal y están involucrados en movimientos oculares reflexivos. Otros axones terminan en el núcleo supraquiasmático y están involucrados en la regulación del ciclo de sueño-vigilia. Su diámetro aumenta de aproximadamente 1,6 mm dentro del ojo a 3.5 mm en la órbita a 4.5 mm dentro del espacio craneal. Las longitudes del componente del nervio óptico son de 1 mm en el globo, 24 mm en la órbita, 9 mm en el canal óptico y 16 mm en el espacio craneal antes de unir el quiasma óptico. Allí, se produce decusación parcial, y aproximadamente el 53% de las fibras se cruzan para formar los tractos ópticos. La mayoría de estas fibras terminan en el cuerpo geniculado lateral.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Optic nerve
Content: The optic nerve is the second of twelve paired cranial nerves and is technically part of the central nervous system, rather than the peripheral nervous system because it is derived from an out-pouching of the diencephalon (optic stalks) during embryonic development. As a consequence, the fibers of the optic nerve are covered with myelin produced by oligodendrocytes, rather than Schwann cells of the peripheral nervous system, and are encased within the meninges. Peripheral neuropathies like Guillain–Barré syndrome do not affect the optic nerve. However, most typically the optic nerve is grouped with the other eleven cranial nerves and considered to be part of the peripheral nervous system.
---

Montagu presented a unique theory for his time: "in biology race is defined as a subdivision of species which inherits physical characteristics distinguishing it from other populations of the species. In this sense there are many human 'races.' But this is not the sense in which many anthropologists, race-classifiers, and racists have used the term." He admits that in a biological sense, there is the existence of races within mankind. However, he also believes that not all of mankind can be classified. Part of his reasoning has to do with mixed origin, which has resulted in “overlapping” of physicalities. Instead of races and subspecies, he prefers mixed ethnic groups. His writing further emphasizes the complexity of our descent and rejects claims that support one race being superior when compared to others. He also says profoundly that the "so-called" main divisions of mankind are species instead of races.

Title: Westminster Cathedral
Content: The founder of Westminster Cathedral, Cardinal Herbert Vaughan laid great emphasis on the beauty and integrity of the cathedral's liturgy. Initially, he determined there should be a community of Benedictine monks at the new cathedral, performing the liturgies and singing the daily Office. This caused great resentment amongst the secular clergy of the diocese, who felt they were being snubbed. In the end, negotiations with both the English Benedictines and the community of French Benedictines at Farnborough failed and a 'traditional' choir of men and boys was set up instead. Despite great financial problems, the Choir School opened on 5 October 1901 with eleven boy choristers, in the building originally intended for the Benedictine monks. Cardinal Vaughan received the boys with the words "You are the foundation stones". The Cathedral Choir was officially instituted three months later in January 1902. Sung Masses and Offices were immediately established when the cathedral opened for worship in 1903, and have continued without interruption ever since. Today, Westminster Cathedral Choir is the only professional Catholic choir in the world to sing daily Mass and Vespers.

While water-soluble compounds generally diffuse freely across the microdialysis membrane, the situation is not as clear for highly lipophilic analytes, where both successful (e.g. corticosteroids) and unsuccessful microdialysis experiments (e.g. estradiol, fusidic acid) have been reported. However, the recovery of water-soluble compounds usually decreases rapidly if the molecular weight of the analyte exceeds 25% of the membrane’s molecular weight cutoff.

Title: Iglesia de Bauska del Espíritu Santo
Content: La Iglesia del Espíritu Santo es una iglesia luterana y el edificio existente más antiguo de Bauska, Letonia. Construido entre 1591 y 1594 para las necesidades de la población alemana báltica de la ciudad. El edificio original no tenía una torre, que fue construida en 1614 y completada en 1623 por el maestro artesano Michael Ulrich de Arnstadt, quien construyó una cúpula y una torre de alta Steeple. En 1799, el campanario fue arruinado por un rayo directo y la torre estaba cubierta por una estructura de madera temporal. En 1815, la torre dañada fue alcanzada por un rayo una vez más y el techo temporal de cuatro pisos se vuelve permanente.

Title: Historia de la nacionalidad holandesa
Content: Aunque los gobiernos urbanos mostraron signos raros de democracia, eran principalmente un sistema oligárquico marcado por una jerarquía exclusiva. Sin embargo, las divisiones de clase no eran tan profundas como en otros estados europeos, y los derechos que poseía la clase común no diferían mucho de lo que los intelectuales podían practicar. Hubo una armonía cultural y evitó la formación de dos clases completamente divididas y permitió una participación social de todos. Del mismo modo, la base de la educación era la misma para todos, y esto permitió un vínculo social. La diferencia en los derechos que poseía las clases superiores e bajas se redujo a la cantidad de dinero disponible para el individuo. Si uno fuera rico, podría pagar una educación de nivel superior. Sin embargo, esto solo no le ganó ningún privilegio político o derechos políticos extensos, sino solo la capacidad de ganar más riqueza. 
Toda la población de la República holandesa no tenía la opción de votar por el representante del país en la medida en que no había una opción entre una democracia y una aristocracia, sino entre una aristocracia y una monarquía. El Stadtholder sería miembro de la Casa de Orange-Nassau.
