prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Teoría celular
Content: En biología, la teoría celular es la teoría científica histórica, ahora universalmente aceptada, que los organismos vivos están formados por células, que son la unidad estructural/organizativa básica de todos los organismos, y que todas las células provienen de células preexistentes. Las células son la unidad básica de estructura en todos los organismos y también la unidad básica de reproducción. Con mejoras continuas realizadas a los microscopios a lo largo del tiempo, la tecnología de aumento avanzó lo suficiente como para descubrir células en el siglo XVII. Este descubrimiento se atribuye en gran medida a Robert Hooke, y comenzó el estudio científico de células, también conocido como biología celular. Más de un siglo después, muchos debates sobre células comenzaron entre los científicos. La mayoría de estos debates involucraron la naturaleza de la regeneración celular y la idea de las células como una unidad fundamental de vida. La teoría celular finalmente se formuló en 1839. Esto generalmente se acredita a Matthias Schleiden y Theodor Schwann. Sin embargo, muchos otros científicos como Rudolf Virchow contribuyeron a la teoría. Fue un paso importante en el movimiento lejos de la generación espontánea.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: University of Toronto
Content: The discovery of insulin at the University of Toronto in 1921 is considered among the most significant events in the history of medicine. The stem cell was discovered at the university in 1963, forming the basis for bone marrow transplantation and all subsequent research on adult and embryonic stem cells. This was the first of many findings at Toronto relating to stem cells, including the identification of pancreatic and retinal stem cells. The cancer stem cell was first identified in 1997 by Toronto researchers, who have since found stem cell associations in leukemia, brain tumors and colorectal cancer. Medical inventions developed at Toronto include the glycaemic index, the infant cereal Pablum, the use of protective hypothermia in open heart surgery and the first artificial cardiac pacemaker. The first successful single-lung transplant was performed at Toronto in 1981, followed by the first nerve transplant in 1988, and the first double-lung transplant in 1989. Researchers identified the maturation promoting factor that regulates cell division, and discovered the T-cell receptor, which triggers responses of the immune system. The university is credited with isolating the genes that cause Fanconi anemia, cystic fibrosis and early-onset Alzheimer's disease, among numerous other diseases. Between 1914 and 1972, the university operated the Connaught Medical Research Laboratories, now part of the pharmaceutical corporation Sanofi-Aventis. Among the research conducted at the laboratory was the development of gel electrophoresis.
---

Las enzimas digestivas se encuentran en los tractos digestivos de los animales (incluidos los humanos) y en las trampas de las plantas carnívoras, donde ayudan en la digestión de los alimentos, así como en las células internas, especialmente en sus lisosomas, donde funcionan para mantener la supervivencia celular. Title: Planarian
Content: The planarian has very simple organ systems. The digestive system consists of a mouth, pharynx, and a gastrovascular cavity. The mouth is located in the center of the underside of the body. Digestive enzymes are secreted from the mouth to begin external digestion. The pharynx connects the mouth to the gastrovascular cavity. This structure branches throughout the body allowing nutrients from food to reach all extremities. Planaria eat living or dead small animals that they suck up with their muscular mouths. Food passes from the mouth through the pharynx into the intestines where it is digested by the cells lining the intestines. Then its nutrients diffuse to the rest of the planaria.

Content: La zona de falla KOA (pronunciada Coe-wah-hee) es una serie de escarpes de fallas que conecta las zonas de grietas este y suroeste en el volcán Kilauea en la gran isla de Hawai. Los límites de la zona de falla de Koa también cubren 2 kilómetros en una orientación norte-sur a lo largo de la longitud de 12 kilómetros. Se cree que la zona de falla ha estado activa durante decenas de miles de años. Title: Teton Fault
Content: The Teton fault is located in a unique geologic setting. The fault is on the boundary of four major geologic provinces: the Basin and Range, Idaho-Wyoming Thrust belt, Rocky Mountain Foreland, and the Yellowstone volcanic plateau. The Basin and Range province is a region of east-west crustal extension. This province adds tension perpendicular to the fault line causing the fault blocks to move apart. The Idaho-Wyoming Thrust belt is located south of the Teton fault and is a region of thick and deformed crust that prevents the fault from extending farther south. The Rocky Mountain Foreland is located east of the Teton fault and is a region of thicker crust. This section of crust is heavier and adds to the vertical downward force on the hanging wall of fault. The Yellowstone volcanic plateau is a region of uplift and expansion that influences both vertical and horizontal forces on the Teton fault.
---

Title: Eugene Sternberg
Content: Eugene Sternberg (15 de enero de 1915-5 de junio de 2005) fue un arquitecto estadounidense nacido en Austrohúngaro conocido por su apasionado compromiso y contribución a la arquitectura contemporánea/modernista y la planificación de la ciudad en Colorado y otros estados de montaña rocosa entre 1950 y 1990. Diseñó más de 400 proyectos de construcción y subdivisiones, muchos de ellos ejemplos icónicos de arquitectura modernista. Dado que su enfoque era mejorar la calidad de vida de la población general, las estructuras que construyó eran hermosas, útiles y rentables. La mayoría de sus proyectos estaban en la categoría de arquitectura social: viviendas asequibles, proyectos de vivienda para personas mayores, viviendas públicas, hospitales, clínicas médicas, escuelas públicas, colegios comunitarios, centros comunitarios, iglesias, edificios para cooperativas de crédito, sindicatos y oficinas de la sede para asociaciones eléctricas rurales. Como planificador, Sternberg diseñó una serie de innovadoras subdivisiones de viviendas y planes maestros para campus universitarios, complejos gubernamentales, recinto ferial del condado y varias pequeñas ciudades occidentales.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Eugene Sternberg
Content: Sternberg was born during World War I in Pressburg, Austria-Hungary where his family had moved to be with his father while he served in the Austro-Hungarian army. When the war, and the Austro-Hungarian Empire, ended in 1918, the family returned to their home in Munkács (now Mukachevo, Ukraine) in the province of Ruthenia; in 1920 it became part of the newly created country of Czechoslovakia.
During his elementary and high school education. Sternberg's major passion was art. He developed into an accomplished young artist and won a coveted place to study architecture at the Czech Technical University in Prague. In the summers he worked for two architectural firms in Munkács and for a well-known Czech architect, Frantisek Libra, in Prague. In 1938, he earned a first degree in architecture/engineering. Adolf Hitler's Germany occupied Czechoslovakia in March 1939. Because Sternberg was offered a scholarship to the University of London's Bartlett School of Architecture he was fortunate to leave Czechoslovakia in 1939, the only one of his large Jewish family to be able to do so.
---

claim: Fiji is an island nation in the South-West Pacific Ocean, located roughly midway between its nearest neighbours Vanuatu to the west and Tonga to the east
question_en: Where is Fiji located in the world?
report_en: Fiji is an island nation in the South-West Pacific Ocean, located roughly midway between its nearest neighbours Vanuatu to the west and Tonga to the east [1]. The archipelago spreads across longitudes 176° 53′ E to 178° 12′ W, with the 180° meridian slicing through the island of Taveuni; however, the International Date Line bends around the group so the entire country observes the same time zone (UTC+12) [1]. Most of Fiji’s islands lie between latitudes 15° 42′ S and 20° 02′ S, placing them in the tropical southern hemisphere, while the outlying dependency of Rotuma sits farther north at about 12° 30′ S [1].

Title: Henri Temianka
Content: In his teens Temianka played a Laurentius Storioni of 1780. While traveling under the aegis of the Curtis Institute, he briefly played a loaned Stradivarius, which was exchanged for a Januarius Gagliano. In 1929 Temianka owned the violin made in 1752 by Joannes Baptista Guadagnini. In the 1930s he played a Silvestre violin, with which he made his early Vintage recordings, and subsequently a Januarius Gagliano and a Carlo Bergonzi.
The Stradivarius he played during the years of the Paganini Quartet was the "Comte Cozio di Salabue" of 1727, which was Paganini's own concert violin. It was later played by Martin Beaver, first violinist of the Tokyo String Quartet, which played since 1995 on the same quartet of Stradivarius instruments once owned by Paganini, until the Tokyo String Quartet retired in July 2013. These remarkable instruments—the viola had inspired Paganini to commission Hector Berlioz's "Harold en Italie"—were also played by the Cleveland Quartet for almost 15 years, beginning in 1982, and are presently owned by Nippon Music Foundation of Japan, after deacquisition by the Corcoran Gallery in the mid-1990s for $15 million. They were then played for several years by the Hagen Quartet, and are now in the hands of the Quartetto di Cremona.
When the years of the Paganini Quartet came to an end, Temianka played a Michelangelo Bergonzi of 1759. His recordings of the Handel Sonatas were made on an Andrea Guarneri of 1687.In February 2013, Chapman University endowed the Henri Temianka Professorship in Music and Scholarship in String Studies. The violin played by Albert Saparoff, concertmaster of the Hollywood Symphony, was endowed as the Temianka-Saparoff violin, and is dedicated for the use of a selected recipient while studying there.
---

The early Spanish explorers of the mid-16th century in the Southeast encountered Mississippian-culture villages and chiefs. The anthropologist John R. Title: History of the Jews in England
Content: English Jews experienced a "golden age" of sorts under Henry II in the late 12th century due to huge economic expansion and increased demand for credit. Major Jewish fortunes were made in London, Oxford, Lincoln, Bristol, and Norwich. The Crown, in turn, capitalized on the prosperity of its Jews. In addition to many arbitrary taxes, Richard I established the Ordinance of the Jewry in 1194 in an attempt to organize the Jewish community. It ensured that mandatory records would be kept by royal officials for all Jewish transactions. Every debt was recorded on a chirography to allow the king immediate and complete access to Jewish property. Richard also established a special exchequer to collect any unpaid debts due after the death of a Jewish creditor. The establishment of the Exchequer of the Jews eventually made all transactions of the English Jewry liable to taxation by the king in addition to the 10% of all sums recovered by Jews with the help of English courts. So, while the First and Second Crusades increased anti-Jewish sentiments, Jews in England went relatively unscathed beyond occasional fines and special levies. Though they did not experience the same kind of social mobility and cultural advancements that Jews under Muslim rule did, the Jews of England's population and prosperity increased under the protection of the king.

Title: Declaración de derechos 1689
Content: La Declaración de Derechos, también conocida como la Declaración de Derechos del Inglés, es una Ley del Parlamento de Inglaterra que establece ciertos derechos civiles básicos y aclara quién sería el próximo en heredar la Corona. Recibió el consentimiento real el 16 de diciembre de 1689 y es una reexpresión en la forma legal de la Declaración de Derecha presentada por el Parlamento de la Convención a William III y Mary II en febrero de 1689, invitándolos a convertirse en Soberanos Conjuntos de Inglaterra. La Declaración de Derechos establece límites sobre los poderes del monarca y establece los derechos del Parlamento, incluido el requisito de parlamentos regulares, elecciones libres y libertad de expresión en el parlamento. Establece ciertos derechos de las personas, incluida la prohibición del castigo cruel e inusual y restableció el derecho de los protestantes a tener armas para su defensa dentro del estado de derecho. Además, la Declaración de Derechos describió y condenó varias fechorías de James II de Inglaterra.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: United States Bill of Rights
Content: The Bill of Rights in the United States is the first ten amendments to the United States Constitution. Proposed following the often bitter 1787–88 debate over ratification of the U.S. Constitution, and written to address the objections raised by Anti-Federalists, the Bill of Rights amendments add to the Constitution specific guarantees of personal freedoms and rights, clear limitations on the government's power in judicial and other proceedings, and explicit declarations that all powers not specifically delegated to Congress by the Constitution are reserved for the states or the people. The concepts codified in these amendments are built upon those found in several earlier documents, including the Virginia Declaration of Rights and the English Bill of Rights, along with earlier documents such as Magna Carta (1215). In practice, the amendments had little impact on judgments by the courts for the first 150 years after ratification.
---

Ha aparecido en muchas obras derivadas y comercialización, y ha sido referenciada o parodiada en varios programas de televisión y películas. Su peinado "Buns de canela" de "Star Wars" (1977) y bikini de metal de "Return of the Jedi" se han convertido en íconos culturales.
Leia fue creada por el creador de "Star Wars" George Lucas, quien en 1999 explicó su desarrollo temprano de los personajes principales:
En el draft áspero de "Star Wars", Leia es la hija adolescente mimada del rey Kayos y la reina Breha de Aquilae, con dos hermanos, Biggs y Windy; Biggs regresó al cuarto borrador como amigo de la infancia de Luke. Leia estaba en un momento "la hija de Owen Lars y su esposa Beru ... El primo de Luke, en general, visitan la tumba de su madre, que pereció con su padre en un planeta destruido por la estrella de la muerte". Una sinopsis de la historia posterior establece Leia como "Leia Antilles", la hija de la fianza de Antilles del mundo pacífico de Organa Major. En el cuarto borrador se estableció que "Leia Organa" vino en cambio de Alderaan.

Title: Princess Leia
Content: Leia's unique hairdo in 1977's "A New Hope" has come to be known as the "doughnut" or "cinnamon buns" hairstyle, and is iconic of the character and series. A February 1978 cover story for the British teen magazine "Jackie" included step-by-step instructions on how to replicate Leia's hair buns. In the 1978 short film parody "Hardware Wars", Princess Anne-Droid has actual cinnamon buns on the side of her head. Miss Piggy of "The Muppet Show" copied the hairdo in a "Star Wars"-themed episode of the series in February 1980. In the 1987 Mel Brooks comedy film "Spaceballs", Princess Vespa (Daphne Zuniga) appears to have the hairstyle, which is soon revealed to in fact be a large pair of headphones. In the parody film "Thumb Wars", the role of Leia was filled by a character named Princess Bunhead, who has two cinnamon rolls for hair. In 2015, Fisher's daughter Billie Lourd's character in the horror-comedy TV series "Scream Queens", a rich and disaffected sorority girl known as Chanel No. 3, wears earmuffs in every scene as an homage to Fisher's iconic Leia hairstyle. Lourd also has a cameo in "The Force Awakens" (2015) in which she wears Leia's distinctive hair buns.

He grew up in the affluent Chicago suburb of Lake Forest and attended Lake Forest Academy, Phillips Exeter Academy in Exeter, New Hampshire, and Princeton University. William Free agency. While at Princeton all four brothers were members of the Tiger Inn eating club. "My father insisted on accomplishment," Aubrey recalled in 1986. Heidegger es mejor conocido por sus contribuciones a la fenomenología y el existencialismo, aunque como la "Enciclopedia de Filosofía de Stanford" advierte ", su pensamiento debe identificarse como parte de tales movimientos filosóficos solo con un cuidado y calificación extrema". La membresía de Heidegger y el apoyo público para el Partido Nazi han sido objeto de una controversia generalizada con respecto a la medida en que su nazismo influyó en su filosofía.

Document ID: 2
Title: Martin Heidegger
Content: Heidegger was born in rural Meßkirch, Baden-Württemberg, the son of Johanna (Kempf) and Friedrich Heidegger. Raised a Roman Catholic, he was the son of the sexton of the village church that adhered to the First Vatican Council of 1870, which was observed mainly by the poorer class of Meßkirch. His family could not afford to send him to university, so he entered a Jesuit seminary, though he was turned away within weeks because of the health requirement and what the director and doctor of the seminary described as a psychosomatic heart condition. Heidegger was short and sinewy, with dark piercing eyes. He enjoyed outdoor pursuits, being especially proficient at skiing.

Según la propia cuenta de Zhou, estaba muy cerca de su madre adoptiva y adquirió su interés duradero en la literatura china y la ópera de ella. Title: Julio César Chappelle
Content: Julius César Chappelle (1852–1904) era un político afroamericano nacido en la esclavitud en Carolina del Sur. Después de la Guerra Civil estadounidense, vivió por un tiempo con su familia en Lavilla, Florida, ayudando a desarrollar la nueva ciudad. En 1870, fue uno de los numerosos migrantes negros del sur a Boston, Massachusetts, que tenía una próspera comunidad negra y una fuerte historia abolicionista. Más tarde se unió al Partido Republicano que fue fundado por abolicionistas, y Chappelle fue elegido para dos términos en la Legislatura del Estado de Massachusetts, que sirve 1883-1886. Julius César Chappelle también fue el primer afroamericano en servir en el Comité del Senado del Estado de Massachusetts, donde cumplió tres períodos. Chappelle estuvo activo en el apoyo a los derechos civiles, tratando de reducir la discriminación y los asuntos del consumidor. Sus discursos fueron frecuentemente cubiertos por periódicos. A lo largo de su vida y su carrera política, ocupó puestos de mantenimiento del gobierno de supervisión secundaria, como en la oficina de correos de los Estados Unidos y la Aduana de los Estados Unidos en Boston. Aunque Julius César Chappelle puede haber adornado las mismas páginas en los periódicos que Frederick Douglass, Chappelle no es tan conocido porque no se sabe que ha dejado una gran de una huella literaria, como escribir manuscritos o para folletos.

Title: Julius Caesar Chappelle
Content: The Chappelle's were split on the prohibition issue, Lewis Chappelle, Julius C. Chappelle's brother and a prominent construction contractor in Florida, was for prohibition but belonged to a non-politically based anti-alcohol group. Lewis Chappelle's son, music prodigy Pat H. Chappelle known as the "Pioneer of Negro Vaudeville," who owned traveling The Rabbit's Foot Company was also in the theater and saloon business, and would visit his uncle Julius Caesar Chappelle in Boston, Massachusetts. Julius Caesar Chappelle and his constituents, colleagues, and friends took a stand against prohibition.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Montana vigilantes
Content: La historia de la justicia vigilante y los vigilantes de Montana comenzó en 1863 en lo que en ese momento era una parte remota del territorio del este de Idaho. Las actividades vigilantes continuaron, aunque algo esporádicamente, a través del período territorial de Montana hasta que el territorio se convirtió en el estado de Montana el 8 de noviembre de 1889. Surgió el vigilantismo porque la policía territorial y los tribunales tenían muy poco poder en los campos mineros remotos durante el período territorial.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Montana Vigilantes
Content: The first written account of the vigilantes was Thomas Dimsdale's "Vigilantes of Montana" which first appeared as a series of articles in 1865 editions of the "Montana Post", Virginia City's and Montana's first newspaper. Dimsdale was a member of the Alder Gulch Vigilance Committee and editor of the "Montana Post." His early accounts of the Alder Gulch vigilante events are widely cited and the book version of his articles, the first book published in Montana Territory in 1866, has been extensively reprinted since its first edition.
X. Biedler, one of the Alder Gulch and Helena vigilante enforcers wrote about his vigilante activities in his personal journals. They weren't available until well after his death when Helen F. Sanders, the daughter-in-law of Wilbur Sanders finally got them published in 1957. Nathaniel Langford, also a member of the vigilantes, explorer of the upper Yellowstone (1870), first superintendent of Yellowstone National Park (1872–1877), territorial tax collector (1864–1869) and author published "Vigilante Days and Ways-Pioneers of the Rockies" in 1893 after he returned to his home in Minnesota. In a 1912 speech to the Montana Historical Society, western historian, Olin Wheeler provided positive commentary on the Alder Gulch vigilantes in a tribute to the life of Nathaniel Langford.
Another account, not published until 1982, is that of former Montana Supreme Court Justice (1922–1935) Lew L. Callaway. Edited by his son Lew Callaway Jr., "Montana's Righteous Hangmen:The Vigilantes in Action" stems from Callaway's association with vigilante Captain James William in the late 1800s. Lew Callaway wrote extensively about the vigilantes and his stories which add more intimate details about how the vigilantes operated are captured in this volume. Although some vigilante activities during this period were criticized by citizens and civic leaders, there was a general affirmation of their purpose and contribution to law and order in a growing territory. Mark C. Dillon's "Montana Vigilantes 1863–1870 Gold, Guns and Gallows" (2013) concludes that given the lawless environment and criminal activity in Alder Gulch and Helena at the time, the lack of any functioning justice system and the understanding of due process at the time, the vigilantes acted in a way they thought was best for their communities. He contends that judging the vigilantes by today's understanding and standards of due process is problematic.
In 2004, Frederick Allen, a journalist and historian, published "A Decent and Orderly Lynching:The Montana Vigilantes" reviewed as an up-to-day balanced account of Montana's vigilante history (1864–1870). Allen's book reinforces the motivations and methods of the earliest vigilantes in Alder Gulch while commenting on the growing disdain for vigilantism in the late 1860s. More generalist works on Montana history such as Merrill G. Burlingame's "The Montana Frontier" (1942) and Michael P. Malone's "Montana-A History of Two Centuries" (1991) adequately summarize the vigilante period largely based on earlier accounts by Dimsdale, Langford and Biedler. Additionally, many topical histories of Montana, such as novelist and Montana historian Dan Cushman's "Montana: The Gold Frontier" (1973) cover the vigilante period.
---
Using the above information, the response is the answer to the query or task: "When was the Montana Vigilantes formed?" in a single sentence.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Windows XP
Content: El 14 de abril de 2009, Windows XP salió de soporte principal e ingresó a la fase de soporte extendida; Microsoft continuó proporcionando actualizaciones de seguridad todos los meses para Windows XP, sin embargo, ya no se ofrecían soporte técnico gratuito, reclamos de garantía y cambios de diseño. El apoyo extendido terminó el 8 de abril de 2014, más de 12 años desde el lanzamiento de XP; Normalmente, los productos de Microsoft tienen un ciclo de vida de soporte de solo 10 años. Más allá de las actualizaciones de seguridad finales publicadas el 8 de abril, no se proporcionan más parches de seguridad o información de soporte para XP gratuito; Los "parches críticos" aún se crearán y se pondrán a disposición solo para los clientes que se suscriben a un plan de "soporte personalizado" pagado. Como es un componente de Windows, todas las versiones de Internet Explorer para Windows XP también se quedaron sin apoyo.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Windows XP
Content: Despite the approaching end of support, there were still notable holdouts that had not migrated past XP; many users elected to remain on XP because of the poor reception of Windows Vista, sales of newer PCs with newer versions of Windows declined due to the Great Recession and the effects of Vista, and deployments of new versions of Windows in enterprise environments require a large amount of planning, which includes testing applications for compatibility (especially those that are dependent on Internet Explorer 6, which is not compatible with newer versions of Windows). Major security software vendors (including Microsoft itself) planned to continue offering support and definitions for Windows XP past the end of support to varying extents, along with the developers of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Opera web browsers; despite these measures, critics similarly argued that users should eventually migrate from XP to a supported platform. The United States' Computer Emergency Readiness Team released an alert in March 2014 advising users of the impending end of support, and informing them that using XP after April 8 may prevent them from meeting US government information security requirements.
Microsoft continued to provide Security Essentials virus definitions and updates for its Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT) for XP until July 14, 2015. claim: Whole cow’s milk is explicitly described as having “too much protein” for infants, while the protein in breast milk is more appropriate for their needs
question_en: Does human breast milk have higher protein than cow milk?
report_en: No; human breast milk contains less protein than cow’s milk. claim: Greed—defined as an intense desire for more—can sometimes promote beneficial outcomes because the pursuit of personal gain often spurs risk-taking, efficiency improvements, and innovation that raise overall wealth; proponents such as financier Ivan Boesky argued in a 1986 Berkeley commencement address that “greed is healthy” and compatible with self-respect, a stance dramatized by Gordon Gekko’s “greed is good” speech in the 1987 film “Wall Street,” which claims greed “clarifies, cuts through, and captures the essence of the evolutionary spirit”
question_en: Can greed be a good thing?
report_en: Greed—defined as an intense desire for more—can sometimes promote beneficial outcomes because the pursuit of personal gain often spurs risk-taking, efficiency improvements, and innovation that raise overall wealth; proponents such as financier Ivan Boesky argued in a 1986 Berkeley commencement address that “greed is healthy” and compatible with self-respect, a stance dramatized by Gordon Gekko’s “greed is good” speech in the 1987 film “Wall Street,” which claims greed “clarifies, cuts through, and captures the essence of the evolutionary spirit” [1]. By motivating individuals to work harder, invest, and compete, greed can increase productivity and expand markets, much as Adam Smith’s “invisible hand” describes self-interest unintentionally benefiting society. However, when unchecked by regulation or ethical norms, greed can also fuel fraud, inequality, and systemic risk—Boesky himself was later jailed for insider trading—so the key question is not whether greed can ever be good, but whether institutions channel it toward socially constructive ends while limiting its destructive potential.

claim: children in 1990, rates of acute Hepatitis B have fallen by 82 %, demonstrating both the virus’s prior ease of transmission and the effectiveness of immunization in curbing its spread
question_en: Is Hepatitis contagious?
report_en: Yes—Hepatitis B is a contagious virus that infects the liver and can spread from an infected person to others, manifesting as either a short-term acute illness or a long-term chronic condition [1]. Because the virus is readily transmissible at birth, about 90 % of infants who acquire it develop chronic infection, whereas the risk decreases as children get older [1]. Since the vaccine became routine for U.S. children in 1990, rates of acute Hepatitis B have fallen by 82 %, demonstrating both the virus’s prior ease of transmission and the effectiveness of immunization in curbing its spread [1].

Desde 1982, cuando la vacuna estuvo disponible, más de 100 millones de personas han recibido la vacuna en los Estados Unidos y no se han informado efectos secundarios graves.

Title: Campo magnético de la Tierra
Content: El campo magnético de la Tierra, también conocido como el campo geomagnético, es el campo magnético que se extiende desde el interior de la Tierra hasta el espacio, donde se encuentra con el viento solar, una corriente de partículas cargadas que emanan del Sol. Su magnitud en la superficie de la Tierra varía de 25 a 65 microteslas (0.25 a 0.65 Gauss). Aproximadamente, es el campo de un dipolo magnético actualmente inclinado en un ángulo de aproximadamente 11 grados con respecto al eje rotacional de la Tierra, como si hubiera un imán de barra colocado en ese ángulo en el centro de la Tierra. El polo geomagnético del norte, ubicado cerca de Groenlandia en el hemisferio norte, es en realidad el polo sur del campo magnético de la Tierra, y el polo geomagnético sur es el Polo Norte. El campo magnético es generado por corrientes eléctricas debido al movimiento de las corrientes de convección de hierro fundido en el núcleo externo de la Tierra impulsado por el calor que se escapan del núcleo, un proceso natural llamado Geodynamo.

Title: Omnívoro
Content: Varios mamíferos son omnívoros en la naturaleza, como especies de cerdos, tejones, osos, abrigos, civetas, erizos, zarigüeyas, zorrillos, perezosos, ardillas, mapache, ardillas, ratones y ratas. Hominidae, incluidos humanos y chimpancés, también son omnívoros.
La mayoría de las especies de osos son omnívoros, pero las dietas individuales pueden variar de casi exclusivamente herbívoras a casi exclusivamente carnívoras, dependiendo de qué fuentes de alimentos estén disponibles a nivel local y estacional. Los osos polares se clasifican como carnívoros, tanto taxonómicamente (están en el orden carnivora) y conductualmente (subsisten en una dieta en gran parte carnívora). Dependiendo de la especie de oso, generalmente hay preferencia por una clase de alimentos, ya que las plantas y los animales se digieren de manera diferente. Las subespecies de lobo (incluidos lobos, perros, dingos y coyotes) comen alguna materia vegetal, pero tienen una preferencia general y están orientados evolutivamente hacia la carne. Además, el lobo de Maned es un canido cuya dieta es naturalmente el 50% de la materia vegetal.

Title: Cave of the Angel
Content: It is remarkable the almost complete absence of carnivores, which are only represented by a few bones of "Ursus arctos", "Lynx pardinus" and "Canis lupus". The occurrence of carnivores in other sites, as in Boquete de Zafarraya, alternates with human presence in the stratigraphy. This event is interpreted as a seasonal occupation of the site by humans. When humans leave this habitat, carnivores take place of the site. Since this situation is not observed at Cave of the Angel, and moreover, there is no interruption in the stratigraphy of human presence, it is likely that a long term human occupation took place. In contrast, the existence of those few carnivore remains can be explained as the result of human consumption as so it happens with rabbit remains ("Oryctolagus cuniculus").

Title: Sólido
Content: Las personas han estado utilizando polímeros orgánicos naturales durante siglos en forma de ceras y goma laca, que se clasifica como un polímero termoplástico. Un polímero vegetal llamado Celulosa proporcionó la resistencia a la tracción para las fibras y cuerdas naturales, y a principios del siglo XIX, el caucho natural estaba en uso generalizado. Los polímeros son las materias primas (las resinas) utilizadas para hacer lo que comúnmente se llaman plásticos. Los plásticos son el producto final, creado después de que uno o más polímeros o aditivos se hayan agregado a una resina durante el procesamiento, que luego se forma en una forma final. Los polímeros que han existido, y que están en uso generalizado, incluyen polietileno a base de carbono, polipropileno, cloruro de polivinilo, poliestireno, nylons, poliésteres, acrílicos, poliuretano y policarbonatos, y siliconas a base de silicio. Los plásticos generalmente se clasifican como "mercancías", "especialidad" e "ingeniería" de plásticos.

Title: Sequence-controlled polymer
Content: DNA, RNA and proteins are most common sequence-controlled polymers in living creatures. Inspired by them, polymerization methods, utilizing DNA or RNA as templates to control sequences of polymer, are developed. At first, taking DNA or RNA as templates, scientists developed a series of peptide nucleic acid (PNA)-based polymers, without using DNA polymerases. But this method is limited to polymerization scale and yield. After that, polymerase chain reaction (PCR) is developed, which currently is still the most extensively used sequence-regulated method. By employing enzymes, the yields and scales are greatly increased, but the specificity of enzymes towards natural peptides limits this technique to a certain degree. Nowadays, more attention is paid to utilization of ribosomes to directly mimic the transcription and translation process. This technology called protein engineering is considered as the most promising biological polymerization method for synthesis of sequence-controlled polymers.

Title: Michael Bruxner
Content: El teniente coronel Sir Michael Frederick Bruxner (25 de marzo de 1882 al 28 de marzo de 1970) fue un político y soldado australiano, que sirvió durante muchos años como líder del partido del país y sus predecesores. Nacido en Tabulum, en el norte de Nueva Gales del Sur, Bruxner se educó en la Escuela Armidale y comenzó estudios en la Universidad de Sydney, pero luego se retiró para asumir el empleo como agente de Grazier y Station en Tenterfield. Después de servir en las fuerzas militares ciudadanas desde 1911, Bruxner se alistó en el caballo de luz australiano al estallar la Primera Guerra Mundial en 1914. Sirviendo con distinción en Gallipoli, Egipto y Palestina, fue ascendido a teniente coronel y otorgó la orden de servicio distinguida.

Document ID: 2
Title: Michael Bruxner
Content: Bruxner started his military career when he was commissioned as a second lieutenant on 11 September 1911 in the 6th Australian (New England) Light Horse, Citizen Military Forces, which was redesignated the 5th the following year. When the First World War broke out in September 1914, Bruxner joined up soon after on 10 October 1914 with the 6th Light Horse Regiment in the Australian Imperial Force. Promoted to captain, Bruxner was sent with his unit to take part in the Gallipoli Campaign, being wounded several times. Later, in 1916, he commanded the 6th during part of the Battle of Romani and served with distinction in the Sinai and Palestine Campaign, for which he was mentioned in despatches twice. On 30 May 1917 was appointed by the President of France, Raymond Poincaré, as a Chevalier of the Légion d'honneur "in recognition of distinguished services during the campaign". Also in 1917, Bruxner was appointed to General Headquarters and rose to be assistant adjutant and quartermaster-general of the ANZAC Mounted Division. For his service he was promoted to lieutenant colonel and appointed as a Companion of the Distinguished Service Order (DSO) in 1919.

Title: Calles de Albany, Nueva York
Content: Swallow Street (cuyo nombre era Gage antes de 1790) fue una de las pocas calles de aves cuyo nombre no se mantuvo, su nombre se cambió a Knox Street en 1809. Knox Street se extendería hacia el norte desde Myrtle Avenue a Clinton Avenue y, finalmente, a Livingston Avenue. En 1896, se construyó el bulevar del norte desde esa intersección de Knox y Livingston North hasta Van Rensselaer Boulevard, incluido un puente de 653 pies de largo sobre Tivoli Hollow y las vías del ferrocarril central de Nueva York, un puente moderno todavía lleva a Northern Boulevard en esa ubicación. En 1898 se construyó un puente de 759 pies de largo para llevar a Knox desde Central Avenue sobre Sheridan Hollow hasta Sheridan Avenue, y nuevamente un puente moderno está allí hoy. Cuando se creó Washington Park, Knox Street entre Madison Ave y State Street se compró en 1880 y se eliminaron todos los edificios. Knox Street en el parque es ahora un centro comercial peatonal, llamado Knox Street Mall; Es el único camino recto en el parque. Más tarde, Knox Street de estado a Livingston se cambiaría a Northern Boulevard para que coincida con la calle con la que se encontró, esto dejó el nombre de Knox Street como solo las tres cuadras entre Myrtle y Madison en el vecindario Park South. En 1991, Northern Boulevard, de Livingston a estado, junto con su extensión dentro del Washington Park a Madison Avenue en Willett Street pasó a llamarse Henry Johnson Boulevard en honor a un héroe afroamericano de la Primera Guerra Mundial. El nombre de Northern Boulevard permanece de Livingston a Van Rensselaer Boulevard.

Content: NY 377 begins adjacent to Albany Memorial Hospital at an interchange with US 9 in the city of Albany. The highway initially heads to the northeast as a four-lane, city-maintained road, following Northern Boulevard along the south side of Wolfert's Roost Country Club and the northern edge of a housing tract. After a quarter-mile (0.4 km), the route turns northward onto Van Rensselaer Boulevard, another four-lane street divided by a narrow median. The route runs past two blocks of homes before leaving the Albany city limits and becoming state-maintained as it crosses into the town of Colonie and its village of Menands. Within Menands, NY 377 traverses another mile (1.6 km) of housing tracts before ending at an intersection with NY 378 (Menand Road) northwest of the village center. The northern terminus of NY 377 also serves as the south entrance to Albany Rural Cemetery.

Title: YMCA
Content: El YMCA fue fundado por George Williams, un Draper de Londres, típico de los jóvenes atraídos por las ciudades por la Revolución Industrial. Él y sus colegas estaban preocupados por la falta de actividades saludables para los hombres jóvenes en las principales ciudades; Las opciones disponibles generalmente eran tabernas y burdeles. La idea de Williams surgió de las reuniones que celebró para la oración y la lectura de la Biblia entre sus compañeros de trabajo en un negocio en la ciudad de Londres, y el 6 de junio de 1844, fundó el primer YMCA en Londres con el propósito de "mejorar la condición espiritual de los hombres jóvenes involucrados en las cortinas, bordes y otros comercios". Para 1851, había YMCA en el Reino Unido, Australia, Bélgica, Canadá, Francia, Alemania, los Países Bajos, Suiza y los Estados Unidos.

Title: YMCA
Content: The International Coalition of the YMCA Universities brings together universities from all over the world, including Brazil, England, Germany, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Uruguay, USA, and Venezuela. The universities offer a wide variety of courses on different levels.
Multiple colleges and universities have historically had connections to the YMCA. Springfield College, of Springfield, Massachusetts, was founded in 1885 as an international training school for YMCA Professionals, while one of the two schools that eventually became Concordia University—Sir George Williams College—started from night courses offered at the Montreal YMCA. Northeastern University began out of a YMCA in Boston, and Franklin University began as the YMCA School of Commerce. San Francisco's Golden Gate University traces its roots to the founding of the YMCA Night School on 1 November 1881. Detroit College of Law, now the Michigan State University College of Law, was founded with a strong connection to the Detroit, Michigan YMCA. It had a 99-year lease on the site, and it was only when it expired that the college moved to East Lansing, Michigan. Youngstown State University traces its roots to the establishment of a law school by the local YMCA in 1908. The Nashville School of Law was the YMCA Night Law School until November 1986, having offered law classes since 1911 and the degree of Juris Doctor since January 1927. YMCA pioneered the concept of night school, providing educational opportunities for people with full-time employment. Many YMCAs offer ESL programmes, alternative high school, day care, and summer camp programs. In India, YMCA University of Science and Technology Faridabad was founded in 1969. It offers various programme-related to science and engineering.
---

Title: Richard Lindzen
Content: Lindzen worked on Chapter 7 of 2001 IPCC Working Group 1, which considers the physical processes that are active in real world climate. He had previously been a contributor to Chapter 4 of the 1995 "IPCC Second Assessment". He described the full 2001 IPCC report as "an admirable description of research activities in climate science" although he criticized the Summary for Policymakers. Lindzen stated in May 2001 that it did not truly summarize the IPCC report but had been amended to state more definite conclusions. He also emphasized the fact that the summary had not been written by scientists alone. The NAS panel on which Lindzen served says that the summary was the result of dialogue between scientists and policymakers.

claim: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs
question_en: How many vertebrae does a human have?
report_en: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
all_claims: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
claims_retained: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Esqueleto axial
Content: Al nacer, la mayoría de los humanos tienen 33 vértebras separadas. Sin embargo, durante el desarrollo normal, varias vértebras se fusionan, dejando un total de 24, en la mayoría de los casos. La confusión sobre si hay o no 32-34 vértebras provienen del hecho de que las dos vértebras más bajas, el sacro y el cóccix, son huesos individuales formados por varios huesos más pequeños que se han fusionado. Así es como se cuentan las vértebras: 24 vértebras separadas y el sacro, formado a partir de 5 vértebras fusionadas y el cóccix, formadas a partir de 3-5 vértebras fusionadas. Si cuenta el cóccix y sacrume cada uno como una vértebra, entonces hay 26 vértebras. Si las vértebras fusionadas se cuentan por separado, entonces el número total de vértebras llega entre 32 y 34.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Cat anatomy
Content: Cats have seven cervical vertebrae like almost all mammals, thirteen thoracic vertebrae (humans have twelve), seven lumbar vertebrae (humans have five), three sacral vertebrae (humans have five because of their bipedal posture), and, except for Manx cats and other shorter tailed cats, twenty-two or twenty-three caudal vertebrae (humans have three to five, fused into an internal coccyx). The extra lumbar and thoracic vertebrae account for the cat's enhanced spinal mobility and flexibility, compared to humans. The caudal vertebrae form the "tail", used by the cat as a counterbalance to the body during quick movements. Between their vertebrae, they have elastic discs, useful for cushioning the jump landings.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Taensa
Content: El Taensa y el Natchez estrechamente relacionado son descendientes de la cultura plaquemina prehistórica tardía (1200-1700 CE). La cultura plaquemina era una variante de cultura de Mississippian centrada en el valle del río Mississippi inferior. Tenían instituciones políticas y religiosas complejas y vivían en grandes pueblos centrados en montículos de plataformas ceremoniales. Eran principalmente agricultores que cultivaban maíz, calabazas, calabaza, frijoles y tabaco. Tenían una historia profunda en el área que se extendía a través del anterior Coles Creek (700-1200 CE) y Troyville Cultures (400-700 CE) a la cultura de Marksville (100 aC a 400 CE), que era contemporánea con las culturas de Hopewell de Ohio e Illinois actuales.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Taensa
Content: In 1698 French Catholic missionary priests Antoine Davion and François de Montigny and J. B. La Source (a lay person and possible servant to the priests) visited the Taensa; de Montigny founded a short-lived mission among them. De Montigny at that time records their population as being 700 people. In 1699 French explorer Pierre Le Moyne d'Iberville recorded the Taensa as having 300 warriors and living in seven villages named as Taensas, Chaoucoula, Conchayon, Couthaougoula, Nyhougoula, Ohytoucoulas, and Talaspa. The majority of these names are in the Muskogean Mobilian trade language and not the Natchezan Taensa language.

Title: Victor Emmanuel II de Italia
Content: Victor Emmanuel II (; Nombre completo: "Vittorio Emanuele Maria Alberto Eugenio Ferdinando Tommaso di Savoia"; 14 de marzo de 1820 - 9 de enero de 1878) fue el rey de Sardinia desde 1849 hasta el 17 de marzo de 1861. En ese momento, él asumió el título del rey de Italia y se convirtió en el primer reino de un reino de una italia unida desde el siglo VII, un título en 1878. Los italianos le dieron el epíteto de "Padre de la Patria" (). El monumento Altare della patria (o "vittoriano") en Roma fue construido en su honor.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Victor Emmanuel II of Italy
Content: The rest of Victor Emmanuel II's reign was much quieter. After the Kingdom of Italy was established he decided to continue on as King Victor Emmanuel II instead of Victor Emmanuel I of Italy. This was a terrible move as far as public relations went as it was not indicative of the fresh start that the Italian people wanted and suggested that Sardinia-Piedmont had taken over the Italian Peninsula, rather than unifying it. Despite this mishap, the remainder of Victor Emmanuel II's reign was consumed by wrapping up loose ends and dealing with economic and cultural issues. His role in day-to-day governing gradually dwindled, as it became increasingly apparent that a king could no longer keep a government in office against the will of Parliament. As a result, while the wording of the Statuto Albertino stipulating that ministers were solely responsible to the crown remained unchanged, in practice they were now responsible to Parliament.
---

Title: Universal health care
Content: Following World War II, universal health care systems began to be set up around the world. On July 5, 1948, the United Kingdom launched its universal National Health Service. Universal health care was next introduced in the Nordic countries of Sweden (1955), Iceland (1956), Norway (1956), Denmark (1961), and Finland (1964). Universal health insurance was then introduced in Japan (1961), and in Canada through stages, starting with the province of Saskatchewan in 1962, followed by the rest of Canada from 1968 to 1972. The Soviet Union extended universal health care to its rural residents in 1969. Italy introduced its "Servizio Sanitario Nazionale" (National Health Service) in 1978. Universal health insurance was implemented in Australia beginning with the "Medibank" system which led to universal coverage under the Medicare system.

Title: Elizabeth Blackwell
Content: Elizabeth Blackwell (3 de febrero de 1821 - 31 de mayo de 1910) fue una médica británica, notable como la primera mujer en recibir un título de médico en los Estados Unidos, y la primera mujer en el Registro Médico del Consejo Médico General. Elizabeth Blackwell jugó un papel importante tanto en los Estados Unidos como en el Reino Unido como reformadora social y moral. Ella actuó como pionera en la promoción de la educación de las mujeres en medicina. Las contribuciones de Elizabeth Blackwell siguen siendo celebradas a través de una medalla de Elizabeth Blackwell que se otorga a una mujer cada año que se ha sumado a la causa de promover a las mujeres en medicina. Además, Hobart y William Smith College recientemente crearon una estatua en su campus en honor a Elizabeth Blackwell.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Fanny Jane Butler
Content: Dr. Fanny Jane Butler (5 October 1850 – 26 October 1889) was a medical missionary from England who was among the first female doctors to travel to India and the first fully trained doctor from England to do so. Prior to her work in Kashmir and other parts of India, Butler was a part of the first class of the London School of Medicine for Women, becoming a member of the forefront of female doctors. Butler spent seven years in India until her death in 1889 and opened medical dispensaries in Srinagar and Bhagalpur, where no medical facilities had previously existed. Butler also initiated the building of the first hospital in Srinagar in 1888 called the John Bishop Memorial Hospital and provided necessary medical care for Indian women, for whom little care had been available.

Content: Esta es la velocidad mecánica de fuego, o qué tan rápido se "cicla el arma (cargas, bloqueos, incendios, desbloqueos, expulsos). La medición de la tasa cíclica supone que el arma se está operando lo más rápido posible y no considera las tareas del operador (cambios en la revista, apuntar, etc.). Cuando se extrae el gatillo, la velocidad a la que se disparan las rondas es la velocidad cíclica. Las tasas de incendio cíclicas típicas son de 600–900 rpm para rifles de asalto, 1,000-1,100 rpm en algunos casos, 900-1,200 rpm para pistolas de subestimación y pistolas de máquinas y 600-1,500 rpm para ametralladoras. M134 Miniguns montados en helicópteros de ataque y otros vehículos de combate pueden lograr tasas de fuego de más de 100 rondas por segundo (6,000 rpm). La tasa de fuego cíclica es la única tasa que se puede determinar con precisión.

Title: Fast draw
Content: Fast draw is one of the fastest sports in the world. Every time is measured under one second, from the signal to draw to when the timer is stopped. The current World Fast Draw Association (WFDA) record for Open Class Fast Draw in an event called Standing Balloons is .208 seconds - and that includes the time it takes to react, draw, fire and pop a balloon target at eight feet away. A world class competitor can draw and fire a shot in under half a second. Given that the average human reaction time is around 0.2 to 0.25 seconds, the round is over before most people can react. The reaction times of the best fast draw shooters is 0.145 seconds, which means that the gun is cocked, drawn, aimed (from the hip), and fired in just over 0.06 seconds. To establish a World Fast Draw Association record, a second shot must be fired in the same competition that is no more than 0.30 seconds slower than the first; this is intended to prevent a shot that anticipates the start signal from setting a record. In competitions where two rounds must be fired, at separate targets, less than 0.10 seconds separate the shots.

Content: The single most important risk factor for developing melioidosis is diabetes mellitus, followed by hazardous alcohol use, chronic kidney disease, and chronic lung disease. Person-to-person spread has been described, but is extremely unusual. HIV infection does not predispose to melioidosis.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sismología de reflexión
Content: El inventor canadiense Reginald Fessenden fue el primero en concebir el uso de ondas sísmicas reflejadas para inferir geología. Inicialmente, su trabajo fue sobre la propagación de las ondas acústicas en el agua, motivado por el hundimiento del Titanic por un iceberg en 1912. También trabajó en métodos para detectar submarinos durante la Primera Guerra Mundial. Él solicitó la primera patente sobre un método de exploración sísmica en 1914, que se emitió en 1917. Debido a la guerra, no fue posible para seguir la idea. John Clarence Karcher descubrió reflexiones sísmicas de forma independiente mientras trabajaba para la Oficina de Estándares de los Estados Unidos (ahora el Instituto Nacional de Normas y Tecnología) sobre métodos de sonido que se extiende para detectar artillería. En una discusión con colegas, la idea desarrolló que estas reflexiones podrían ayudar en la exploración del petróleo. Con varios otros, muchos afiliados a la Universidad de Oklahoma, Karcher ayudó a formar la compañía de ingeniería geológica, incorporada en Oklahoma en abril de 1920. Las primeras pruebas de campo se realizaron cerca de Oklahoma City, Oklahoma en 1921.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Reflection seismology
Content: Reflection seismology (or seismic reflection) is a method of exploration geophysics that uses the principles of seismology to estimate the properties of the Earth's subsurface from reflected seismic waves. The method requires a controlled seismic source of energy, such as dynamite or Tovex blast, a specialized air gun or a seismic vibrator, commonly known by the trademark name Vibroseis. Reflection seismology is similar to sonar and echolocation. This article is about surface seismic surveys; for vertical seismic profiles, see VSP.
Reflections and refractions of seismic waves at geologic interfaces within the Earth were first observed on recordings of earthquake-generated seismic waves. The basic model of the Earth's deep interior is based on observations of earthquake-generated seismic waves transmitted through the Earth’s interior (e.g., Mohorovičić, 1910). The use of human-generated seismic waves to map in detail the geology of the upper few kilometers of the Earth's crust followed shortly thereafter and has developed mainly due to commercial enterprise, particularly the petroleum industry.
---

La leyenda afirma que el fútbol de rugby se inició en la hora de 1845 en la escuela de rugby, rugby, Warwickshire, Inglaterra, aunque formas de fútbol en las que se llevó la pelota y se arrojó una fecha a la época medieval. Rugby finalmente se dividió en dos deportes en 1895 cuando veintiún clubes se separaron de la Unión de Fútbol de Rugby original, para formar la Unión del Norte (más tarde se nombrará la Liga de Rugby en 1922) en el Hotel George, Huddersfield, Northern Inglaterra sobre el tema del pago a los jugadores, lo que hace que la liga de rugby sea el primer código para convertir a sus jugadores, Rugby Union se volvió completamente profesional en 1995. Ambos deportes son los deportes que son los deportes que son los deportes que son los deportes que son los respetados. (Rugby Union) y la Federación Internacional de Rugby League (Liga de Rugby). El fútbol de rugby fue una de las muchas versiones del fútbol jugadas en las escuelas públicas inglesas en el siglo XIX. Aunque la liga de rugby inicialmente usó reglas de la Unión de Rugby, ahora son deportes totalmente separados. Además de estos dos códigos, el fútbol estadounidense y canadiense evolucionó del fútbol de rugby.

Title: Rugby Road
Content: An integral part of Rugby Road is "Beta Bridge". In the 1850s, a bridge was erected over the Chesapeake and Ohio train tracks in the location of what is now Beta Bridge, but the current structure was built in 1923. The bridge was a part of a citywide paving and improvement project to prepare Charlottesville area streets for the automobile. Although it was originally known simply as the Rugby Road Bridge, when the Beta Theta Pi fraternity built their house at the corner of Chancellor and Rugby in 1927, it took its current name. In 1971, that fraternity location was closed, and the Delta Upsilon fraternity moved into its current location at 180 Rugby Road. As the unofficial monitors of the bridge, brothers and pledges of DU would paint over offensive messages or messages which did not contain 'THX DU' (for "Thanks Delta Upsilon"). In 2011, Beta Theta Pi moved back into their original house next to the bridge, and now messages typically contain 'THX Beta'.

claim: Firewood banksia (Banksia menziesii) is native to Western Australia, occurring from the Perth region (32° S) north to the Murchison River (27° S) on sandy soils in scrubland or low woodland, and there is no indication it occurs naturally in North America; its cultivation outside similar Mediterranean-type climates is limited because the species is susceptible to dieback in humid summer regions such as Sydney
question_en: Is firewood banksia found in North America?
report_en: Firewood banksia (Banksia menziesii) is native to Western Australia, occurring from the Perth region (32° S) north to the Murchison River (27° S) on sandy soils in scrubland or low woodland, and there is no indication it occurs naturally in North America; its cultivation outside similar Mediterranean-type climates is limited because the species is susceptible to dieback in humid summer regions such as Sydney [1].
all_claims: Firewood banksia (Banksia menziesii) is native to Western Australia, occurring from the Perth region (32° S) north to the Murchison River (27° S) on sandy soils in scrubland or low woodland, and there is no indication it occurs naturally in North America; its cultivation outside similar Mediterranean-type climates is limited because the species is susceptible to dieback in humid summer regions such as Sydney [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Banksia menziesii
Content: Descrito por primera vez por el botánico Robert Brown a principios del siglo XIX, no se reconocen variedades separadas de "Banksia menziesii". Se encuentra en Australia Occidental, desde la región de Perth (32 ° S) al norte hasta el río Murchison (27 ° S), y generalmente crece en suelos arenosos, en matorrales o bosques bajos. "Banksia menziesii" proporciona alimentos para una amplia gama de animales de invertebrados y vertebrados; Las aves y en particular los mieles son visitantes prominentes. Una planta relativamente resistente, "Banksia menziesii" se ve comúnmente en jardines, tiras de la naturaleza y parques en áreas urbanas australianas con climas mediterráneos, pero su sensibilidad a la muerte del molde de agua transmitido por el suelo "Phytophthora cinnamomi" lo hace corto en lugares con veranos húmedos, como Sydney. "Banksia menziesii" se usa ampliamente en la industria de las flores de corte tanto en Australia como en el extranjero.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Banksia prionotes
Content: During data collection for "The Banksia Atlas" project, a single presumed natural hybrid between "B. prionotes" and "B. lindleyana" (porcupine banksia), with fruit like "B. lindleyana" but leaves intermediate between the two parents, was found north of Kalbarri National Park. At the time this was considered an important discovery, as the parent species were thought not to be closely related. Mast's analyses, however, place them both in a clade of eight species, though "B. lindleyana" remains less closely related to "B. prionotes" than "B. hookeriana". Hybrids of "B. prionotes" with "B. menziesii" (firewood banksia) have also been produced by artificial means, and presumed natural hybrids have been recorded.
---

Title: Historia de las películas de ciencia ficción
Content: Las películas de ciencia ficción aparecieron muy temprano en la era del cine mudo. Los intentos iniciales fueron cortometrajes de típicamente de 1 a 2 minutos de duración, filmados en blanco y negro, pero a veces con tinte de color. Estos generalmente tenían un tema tecnológico, y a menudo tenían la intención de ser humorística. "Le Voyage Dans La Lune", creado por Georges Méliès en 1902 a menudo se considera la primera película de ciencia ficción. Se acercó a Jules Verne y H. G. Wells en su descripción de una nave espacial que se lanzó a la luna en un gran cañón. Sus efectos especiales innovadores fueron pioneros en el camino para futuras películas de ciencia ficción, y se hizo muy popular después de su lanzamiento.

Title: What a Cartoon!
Content: The first cartoon from the "What a Cartoon!" project broadcast in its entirety was "The Powerpuff Girls in "Meat Fuzzy Lumkins"", which made its world premiere on Monday, February 20, 1995, during a television special called the "World Premiere Toon-In" (termed "President's Day Nightmare" by its producers, Williams Street). The special was hosted by Space Ghost and the cast of "Space Ghost Coast to Coast", and featured comic interviews and a mock contest with the creators of the various cartoons. The Toon-In was simulcast on Cartoon Network, TBS Superstation, and TNT. To promote the shorts, Cartoon Network's marketing department came up with the concept of "Dive-In Theater" in 1995 to showcase the 48 cartoon shorts. The cartoons were shown at water parks and large municipal swimming pools, treating kids and their parents to exclusive poolside screenings on 9' x 12' movie screens.

Title: Juan parte
Content: John Part (nacido el 29 de junio de 1966) es un jugador y comentarista profesional canadiense, apodado Darth Maple. Parte es un campeón mundial de tres veces, después de haber ganado el BDO World Darts Championship de 1994, y el PDC World Championship en 2003 y 2008. Es estadísticamente el mejor jugador de Darts de América del Norte hasta la fecha. Tiene la distinción de ser el primer jugador que no es del Reino Unido en ganar el Campeonato Mundial, y el único no europeo hasta la fecha para ganar el PDC World Darts Championship. Su primer campeonato fue la segunda vez que un jugador no sembrado ganó el campeonato BDO World Darts, y una de las pocas veces en las que un jugador solo perdió uno en todo el torneo. Su brecha de nueve años entre su primer y segundo campeonato mundial está empatado con Ted Hankey por la brecha más larga entre el campeonato mundial, y su tercer triunfo en 2008 lo vio convertirse en el primer jugador en la historia en ganar un título mundial en tres lugares diferentes, y el primero en ganar en el Palacio Alexandra. Su victoria en 2008 lo vio unirse a Phil Taylor, Eric Bristow, Raymond Van Barneveld y John Lowe como los únicos jugadores con tres o más campeonatos mundiales, y convertirse en el segundo jugador (después de Taylor) en ganar múltiples títulos de PDC. Sus once finales televisadas de PDC están empatadas con Dennis Priestley para el octavo mayor tiempo, y sus £ 874,151 en premios hasta la fecha es la decimosexta cantidad más alta en la historia de PDC.

Title: Red John
Content: By the episode "Blinking Red Light", it is now widely believed that Red John is dead, with Jane and Lisbon the only ones aware he is still alive. One of the people believing Red John to be dead is James Panzer, a blogger pretending to devote his life to find a serial killer known as "the San Joaquin Killer" (abbreviated SJK, who has killed at least five young women). In reality, Panzer is the killer. Jane suspects Panzer but initially lacks the proof to expose him. When he and Panzer both appear on Karen Cross's television talk show discussing the SJK case, Jane recognizes Panzer has to be stopped and goads Panzer into comparing Red John unfavorably to SJK. Panzer rises to the bait, making bold statements that the SJK killings were the work of a genius and Red John by comparison is a ""common sociopath, lazy, sloppy, delusional"" and already forgotten since Jane killed him. Panzer then makes the same mistake made by Jane and Kristina Frye: belittling Red John in a public forum. A couple of hours after the television appearance, Panzer is found murdered, with Red John's smiley face painted in blood on one of the walls near his body. Panzer's murder proves Jane's theory that Red John is still alive. This makes Panzer Red John's ninth male victim.

Title: Mantis
Content: Los parientes más cercanos de las mantis son las termitas y las cucarachas (Blattodea), que están dentro de los Dictyoptera de superorden. Las mantes a veces se confunden con insectos de palo (Phasmatodea), otros insectos alargados como saltamontes (ortoptera) u otros insectos no relacionados con piezas patrocinadas como las moscas de mantis (mantispidae). Las mantis son en su mayoría depredadores de emboscada, pero algunas especies que viven en el suelo se encuentran activamente persiguiendo a sus presas. Normalmente viven durante aproximadamente un año. En climas más fríos, los adultos ponen huevos en otoño, luego mueren. Los huevos están protegidos por sus cápsulas duras y eclosionan en la primavera. Las mujeres a veces practican el canibalismo sexual, comiendo a sus compañeros después de la cópula.
---

Title: Litaneutria minor
Content: "L. minor" is a solitary species and like most other praying mantises will only come together to mate. Mating times for this species are highly dependent upon weather conditions and prey availability. Typically females are most likely to accept a mate and have a successful clutch two weeks after their last molt.

prompt:

Title: Verdete
Content: Verdigris es el nombre común para un pigmento verde obtenido a través de la aplicación de ácido acético a placas de cobre o la pátina natural formada cuando el cobre, el latón o el bronce se resisten y se exponen al aire o agua de mar durante un período de tiempo. Por lo general, es un carbonato básico de cobre, pero cerca del mar será un cloruro básico de cobre. Si el ácido acético está presente en el momento de la meteorización, puede consistir en acetato de cobre (II).
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Statue of Liberty
Content: Originally, the statue was a dull copper color, but shortly after 1900 a green patina, also called verdigris, caused by the oxidation of the copper skin, began to spread. As early as 1902 it was mentioned in the press; by 1906 it had entirely covered the statue. Believing that the patina was evidence of corrosion, Congress authorized for various repairs, and to paint the statue both inside and out. There was considerable public protest against the proposed exterior painting. The Army Corps of Engineers studied the patina for any ill effects to the statue and concluded that it protected the skin, "softened the outlines of the Statue and made it beautiful." The statue was painted only on the inside. The Corps of Engineers also installed an elevator to take visitors from the base to the top of the pedestal.
---

Vio a una multitud récord de 402,413 personas asistir a una ronda del campeonato CART en 2002. claim: Yes, a septic tank can explode because the decomposition of sewage produces sewer gas that contains methane and hydrogen sulfide, both highly flammable and potentially explosive; gas ignition can occur if the mixture contacts an open flame or sparks
question_en: Can a septic tank explode?
report_en: Yes, a septic tank can explode because the decomposition of sewage produces sewer gas that contains methane and hydrogen sulfide, both highly flammable and potentially explosive; gas ignition can occur if the mixture contacts an open flame or sparks [1]. Methane levels have been measured up to about 300 ppmv in closed drains just 2 cm above the sewage, significantly higher than the 7–15 ppmv commonly found in open sewers, indicating that enclosed systems like septic tanks can accumulate concentrations high enough to reach their explosive limits if ventilation is inadequate [1].

Fue nombrado en honor del general Philippe Leclerc de Hauteclocque, quien dirigió el elemento francés del impulso hacia París mientras estaba al mando de la segunda división francesa francesa ("2e db") en la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Document ID: 2
Title: Tanks of the interwar period
Content: The French used a very wide range of tanks, including many unique types. France was the second largest tank producer in the world, behind the Soviet Union (see French armoured fighting vehicle production during World War II). Their cavalry tank class filled the role of what are now called MBTs. They also fielded a heavy tank design, and several lighter types for scouting and infantry support. In addition to these types, they were also working on super-heavy breakthrough tanks (FCM F1). The French didn't have an independent Tank Corps. All tanks belonged to either the Infantry or the Cavalry.The Renault FT-17 had a long life and saw use in World War II and even later in Indochina. It was utilised as far away as in China, during the Chinese Civil wars, and versions of the tank were used both against and by the Japanese during the invasion of China. A large number found their way into both Republican and Nationalist hands during the Spanish Civil War. They were used in the Russian Revolution by both the Bolsheviks and the White Russians, and later by the Finns against the Soviets. France exported the FT-17 right up to World War II. The design was also developed by the Italians as the Fiat 3000 and the USSR as the T-18.

Title: H-E-B
Content: La compañía fue fundada el 26 de noviembre de 1905, cuando Florence Butt abrió el C.C. Copary Store en la planta baja de su casa familiar en Kerrville, Texas. En 1919, Howard Edward Butt, el hijo menor de Florence, se hizo cargo de la tienda a su regreso de la Primera Guerra Mundial. Poco después de convertirse en propietario de la pequeña tienda de su madre, Howard intentó cuatro expansiones en el centro de Texas, incluido uno en Junction, todo lo cual falló. Finalmente, en 1927, Howard lanzó una exitosa segunda tienda en Del Río, Texas, seguida de la compra de tres supermercados en el Valle del Bajo Río Grande. Las primeras iniciales de Howard E. Butt se convirtieron en el nombre de la tienda.

Title: The Food Emporium
Content: Food Emporium's history starts in 1919, when Louis Daitch founded Daitch Crystal Dairies, a public company trading on the American Stock Exchange. Over the years, he opened shops in the New York City area selling butter and eggs. Following World War II, Daitch Crystal Dairies enjoyed tremendous growth in the new supermarket format, emerging in the 1950s as a significant chain. In 1955, Daitch and its 34 stores (in New York City, Nassau and Suffolk counties, and in Connecticut, merged with Shopwell Foods' chain of 18 Westchester County supermarkets. Shopwell was founded by Sigmund Rosengarten, who entered the supermarket business as a butcher. The supermarket chain (known under variations of the Daitch and Shopwell names) underwent a period of significant expansion. Within a year, seven new stores were opened and nine more were added by acquiring the Diamond K chain.

Jacques-Jean was a wealthy and well known banker, who had one son (Jacques Félix Le Coulteux du Molay was born Paris 29 June 1779 and died in Dijon 1 April 1812) with Genevieve before their divorce. During their time together they also bought the famous Malmaison near Paris – some of those styles are reflected in the chateau you now stand. Jacques-Jean later married Alexandrine Sophie Pauline Le Couteulx; the couple had three children.

Utilizaron muchos métodos complejos, como la sublimación de las hormonas esteroides. Otro método especificado por los textos chinos, la primera datación de 1110, especificó el uso de saponina (de los frijoles de "Gleditsia sinensis") para extraer hormonas, pero también se sabía que el yeso (que contiene sulfato de calcio) se usó.

Although the endocrine disruption has been disputed by some, work sessions from 1992 to 1999 have generated consensus statements from scientists regarding the hazard from endocrine disruptors, particularly in wildlife and also in humans.

question_en: What are the Troubles?
report_en: The Troubles were an ethno-nationalist conflict in Northern Ireland that began in the late 1960s, is often characterized as a “guerrilla” or “low-level” war, and is generally considered to have concluded with the 1998 Good Friday Agreement [1]. En la misma fecha, XHBJ-TV Channel 45 dejó caer el canal 5 para Galavisión. Canal 5 reemplazó la programación en inglés de XETV en su señal analógica, para servir a los espectadores de habla hispana en Tijuana que no tenían televisores con sintonizadores digitales incorporados o cajas de convertidores digitales antes de la transición de 2013 del mercado de Tijuana a la televisión digital. El cambio de afiliación coincidió con el comienzo de la multidifusión digital en las estaciones de Tijuana de Televisa. question_en: How much dopamine is in the human brain?
report_en: Because dopamine is constantly synthesized, released, taken back up and enzymatically degraded, its absolute quantity is not fixed, but biochemical measurements in post-mortem tissue indicate that the entire human brain typically contains only a few milligrams of free dopamine at any moment (well below 0.01 g). This modest pool is maintained by roughly 400,000 dopaminergic neurons whose cell bodies are clustered in six small mid-brain and hypothalamic regions (substantia nigra, ventral tegmental area, posterior hypothalamus, arcuate nucleus, zona incerta and periventricular nucleus, corresponding to groups A8–A14) but whose axons project widely and exert strong modulatory effects across the brain [1].

Title: Dopamina
Content: Las neuronas dopaminérgicas (células nerviosas productoras de dopamina) son relativamente pocas, un total de alrededor de 400,000 en el cerebro humano, y sus cuerpos celulares se limitan en grupos a unas pocas áreas cerebrales relativamente pequeñas. Sin embargo, sus axones se proyectan para muchas otras áreas cerebrales, y ejercen poderosos efectos en sus objetivos. Estos grupos de células dopaminérgicas fueron mapeados por primera vez en 1964 por Annica Dahlström y Kjell Fuxe, quienes les asignaron etiquetas comenzando con la letra "A" (para "Aminergic"). En su esquema, las áreas A1 a A7 contienen el neurotransmisor norepinefrina, mientras que A8 a A14 contiene dopamina. Las áreas dopaminérgicas que identificaron son la sustancia negra (grupos 8 y 9); el área tegmental ventral (grupo 10); el hipotálamo posterior (grupo 11); el núcleo arqueado (Grupo 12); La Zona incerta (Grupo 13) y el núcleo periventricular (Grupo 14).

Title: Armada japonesa imperial en la Segunda Guerra Mundial
Content: Incluso después del desastre en el Mar de Filipinas, el IJN seguía siendo una fuerza formidable. De los 12 acorazados que estaban disponibles al comienzo de la guerra en 1941-42, nueve aún permanecían operativos, junto con 14 de los 18 cruceros originales. Sin embargo, los esfuerzos para reconstruir la fuerza portadora no tuvieron éxito ya que la capacitación otorgada a los nuevos aviadores era de un nivel muy bajo. En consecuencia, los nuevos transportistas nunca fueron al mar con un grupo aéreo completo. Esto dejó a los japoneses con una colección de transportistas, dirigida por el "Zuikaku", que fue el único sobreviviente de la Fuerza de Ataque de Pearl Harbor. Los japoneses se quedaron con dos opciones, ya sea para cometer su fuerza restante en una ofensiva total, o para sentarse mientras los estadounidenses ocupaban Filipinas y cortaron los carriles marinos entre Japón y los recursos vitales de las Indias Orientales y Malaya holandesas. El plan ideado por los japoneses fue un intento final de crear una batalla decisiva utilizando su última fuerza restante, la potencia de fuego de sus pesados ​​cruceros y acorazados, que debían ser cometidos contra la cabeza de playa estadounidense en Leyte. Los japoneses planearon usar sus transportistas restantes como cebo, para atraer a los transportistas estadounidenses lejos del Golfo Leyte el tiempo suficiente para que los pesados ​​buques de guerra entren y destruyan los barcos estadounidenses presentes.

Title: Naval tactics in the Age of Steam

Under the terms of the Washington Treaty, Britain, America and Japan were allowed to convert two ships that were due to scrap under the treaty into aircraft carriers. By luck as much as planning, the Americans and Japanese both developed large carriers that were capable of handling up to 90 aircraft, based on the hulls of battlecruisers due to be scrapped under the Washington Treaty. Both navies gradually began to develop new tactics for employing aircraft carriers in battle, although these tactics did not come into full fruition until the middle of the Pacific Campaign of WWII.
